children.label: IV
children.definition: Att. law, accuse a person by προβολή (v. προβολή v), present him as guilty of the offence, προὐβαλόμην ἀδικεῖν τοῦτον περὶ τὴν ἑορτήν D. 21.1 (cf. Harp. s.v. προβαλλομένους) ; π. τινά τι ib. 28; τινα alone, ib. 175; ὁ προβαλλόμενος the prosecutor in a προβολή, ib. 179:— Pass., to be accused or presented, προὐβλήθησαν X. HG 1.7.35: generally, attack, censure, τὸ ἔθος D.H. 4.24, cf. Ph. 2.137; τοὺς ψευδομένους J. BJ 2.8.7 (s. v.l.), cf. Plu. CG 14; opp. ἐπαινεῖν, Id. Aud.poet. 2.18d.

data.quote: προὐβαλόμην ἀδικεῖν τοῦτον περὶ τὴν ἑορτήν

children.definition: dip first, εἰς γάλα τι Sor. 2.32:— Pass., PHolm. 4.2.
load beforehand, τὴν γαστέρα Philostr. Gym. 46.
examine or test before, Hero Aut. 2.5 ( Pass.).
torture before, Luc. Tyr. 17:— Pass., LXX 4 Ma. 10.16, J. AJ 17.5.5; τοῦ θανάτου Id. BJ 5.11.1.
rule or govern before, D.S. 1.51.
property in cattle, abundance of cattle, κειμήλιά τε πρόβασίν τε Od. 2.75; cf. προβατεία.

children.label: II
children.definition: advance, τὰς π. ποιεῖσθαι Str. 7.1.5; progression of musical sounds, Iamb. VP 26.120; π. τῶν χρόνων Sor. 1.110: pl., π. τοῦ νοῦ Ph. 1.595.
growth, Sor. 1.114, Gal. 19.373.
ἐκ προβάσεως, = ἐκ προσαγωγῆς, Maria ap. Zos.Alch. p.158B.
envy before or because of, τινί τινος, prob. for προσ- in Lib. Decl. 29.2.
BGU 954.9 (vi A.D.).

safeguard against witchcraft, amulet or scarecrow hung up before workshops or in fields. LXX Ep.Je. 70, Plu. QConv. 2.681f, Hsch. s.v. κεράμβηλον; = muttonius, Gloss. (also προβασκαντον, = muttonium, ib.); less correct than βασκάνιον, Phryn. 68.
carry away beforehand, POxy. 935.21 (iii A.D.).
wild sheep, Gloss.
keeping of sheep, SIG 1165.4 ( Dodona), J. AJ 1.2.2, AB 294: pl., Plu. Sol. 23, Publ. 11.

children.label: II
children.definition: property in cattle, flock of sheep, Str. 12.3.13, Ael. NA 4.32 (pl.), etc.
of a sheep, [γάλα] Arist. HA 522a22; στέαρ J. AJ 3.11.2; κρέας S.E. P. 3.223, cf. Str. 11.8.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: προβάτειον, τό, = ἀρνόγλωσσον, Ps.- Dsc. 2.126; but προβάτειος, = θύμβρα, Id. 3.37.
suited for pasturage, πόα Ph. 2.91, 131.
grazier, Poll. 7.184.
of or for cattle, κύων sheep-dog, Philostr. VA 6.43, Longus 3.7: ἡ π. τέχνη the art of breeding or keeping sheep, X. Oec. 5.3, cf. Poll. 7.184.
keep cattle, SIG 1165 ( Dodona), App. BC 1.7; tend sheep, AP 7.636 ( Crin.):— Pass., to be grazed by cattle, D.H. 1.37.

children.label: II
children.definition: keep at grass, graze, ἑκατὸν πλείω τὰ μείζονα App. BC 1.8.
sheep-pen, Hdn. Epim. 113; cf. προβατών.
Hsch.

of sheep or goats, π. χορός a chorus of goats, as in the Αἶγες of Eupolis, Eust. 1063.44; ἡ π. πύλη the sheep-gate, LXX Ne. 3.1; without πύλη, Ev.Jo. 5.2 (nisi leg. π. κολυμβήθρα) ; χόρτος π. PGoodsp.Cair. 30 xxxiv 6 (ii A.D.).

Dim. of πρόβατον, little sheep, Ar. V. 955, Pl. 293, Pl. Phdr. 259a, Strato Com. 1.22, Sotad. 9.3, Plu. Fab. 1, Philostr. VA 3.43; π. ἀγαπητόν Men. 319.3; προβατίου βίος Ar. Pl. 922; προβατίου γνώμη Procop. Arc. 13; of a kid, Ar. Av. 856.
shepherd, Hsch. s.v. ἀρηνοβοσκός, Gloss.
good judge of cattle: metaph., good judge of character, A. Ag. 795 (anap.).
sheep-flayer, name of the month Ληναιών, Procl.ad Hes. Op. 502.
slaughterer of sheep, PKlein.Form. 326 (vi A.D.).
sheep-dealer, retailer of sheep, Plu. Per. 24, Com.Adesp. 62.
one who tends sheep, Anon. in Rh. 3.607 W.
keeping sheep and cattle, OGI 655.5 ( Egypt, i B.C.), PHamb. 34.6 (ii A.D.), etc.

definition: πρόβατον, τό, freq. in pl. πρόβατα (but also in sg., Cratin. 43, Pl. Euthd. 302a, etc.); heterocl. dat. πρόβασι Hdn.Gr. 1.414, Hsch.:— used (among the Ionians and Dorians) of all four-footed

children.definition: cattle, Hdt. 2.41, etc.; πάντων τῶν π. βόες μάλιστα ἀτονέουσι Hp. Art. 8; τὰ ἄλλα π. καὶ ἵππους μάλιστα Hdt. 4.61, cf. Pi. Fr. 316, IG 12(1).677.31 ( Rhodes, iv/iii B.C.); of Europaʼs bull, Simon. 28: in Hom. generally of cattle, flocks and herds, Il. 14.124, 23.550, h.Merc. 571, cf. IG 12(7).62.35 ( Amorgos, iv B.C.); τὰ π. καὶ καρταίποδα Leg.Gort. 4.35; opp. ἄνθρωποι, Hes. Op. 558, Hdt. 1.203; τὰ λεπτὰ τῶν π. small cattle, i.e. sheep and goats, ib. 133, 8.137; τὸ μὲν μέζον π. . . , τὸ δὲ μεῖον IG 5 (2).3.14 ( Tegea, iv B.C.); so later, π. ἀπὸ τῶν ἀρνῶν καὶ τῶν ἐρίφων λήψεσθε LXX Ex. 12.5: but in Att. Prose and Com. (never in Trag.) almost invariably of sheep, Ar. Av. 714, Th. 2.14, IG 2(2).1672.289, etc.; ὥσπερ π. βῆ βῆ λέγων βαδίζει Cratin. 43; so in later Boeot., IG 7.3171.39,44 (Orchom. Boeot.): generally, animals for slaughter, whether for sacrifices, Hdt. 6.56; or for food, Id. 1.207; cf. Antipho 5.29.

data.quote: πάντων τῶν π. βόες μάλιστα ἀτονέουσι
τὰ ἄλλα π. καὶ ἵππους μάλιστα
τὸ μὲν μέζον π. . . , τὸ δὲ μεῖον
π. ἀπὸ τῶν ἀρνῶν καὶ τῶν ἐρίφων λήψεσθε
ὥσπερ π. βῆ βῆ λέγων βαδίζει

children.definition: ἀριθμός, πρόβατʼ ἄλλως Ar. Nu. 1203, cf. V. 32: Com. Comp., προβάτου προβάτερον more sheepish than a sheep, dub. cj. in Sophr. 122; χρυσοῦν π., = Lat. pecus aurea, as nickname, D.C. 59.8: in other provs., τοὺς γευομένους κύνας τῶν π. κατακόπτειν φασὶ δεῖν D. 25.40; λέων ἐν προβάτοις Plu. Cleom. 33, cf. Plb. 5.35.13.

data.quote: τοὺς γευομένους κύνας τῶν π. κατακόπτειν φασὶ δεῖν

children.label: II
children.definition: Opp. H. 1.146, 3.139, Ael. NA 9.38. (Orig. of small cattle, sheep and goats, which in primitive mixed herds walk in front ( προβαίνει) of the larger animals.)
sheep-dealer, Ar. Eq. 132, 138.
sheep-pen, Gloss.
keeping of sheep, prob. in Supp.Epigr. 2.579.8 ( Teos, iv B.C.).
breeding sheep, Sch. Pi. P. 12.1.
with coat of sheepʼs skin, Hsch. s.v. οἰοχίτων.
like a sheep, simple, Simp. in Epict. p.34 D., Hsch. s.v. βαίκυλος, Sch. Ar. Eq. 264.
IG ΙΙ(2).287 A 149, al. (iii B.C.), PCair.Zen. 68.2 (iii B.C.), Inscr.Délos 403.51 (ii B.C.), Hdn.Gr. 1.36.
previous dipping, PHolm. 8.20.
substance used in first stage of alloying, Zos.Alch. p.193B., Maria ap. eund. p.212 B.
confirm before, S.E. M. 8.181 ( Pass.).

definition: προβέβουλα, isolated poet. pf. 2 ( προβούλομαι does not occur),

children.definition: prefer one to another, τινά τινος Il. 1.113, Q.S. 13.347; θάνατον δουλοσύνας Ion Lyr. 16: c. inf., AP 9.445 ( Jul.Aegypt.): abs., make plans, Coluth. 199.
premeditatedly, Poll. 6.140.
a step forward, Ar. Pl. 759.
force a measure through, Aeschin. 3.72.

definition: προβιβάζω, fut. -άσω D.C. 58.23, Att. προβῐβῶ Ar. Av. 1570:—

children.definition: προβαίνω, cause to step forward, lead on, τινα S. OC 180 (lyr.); ποῖ προβιβᾷς ἡμᾶς ποτε; to what point, how far do you mean to carry us ? Ar. l.c.; τινὰ εἰς ἀρετήν, εἰς ἐγκράτειαν, Pl. Prt. 328a, X. Mem. 1.5.1; ἕως Μακεδονίας τὴν ἀρχήν extend it . . , D.H. 1.3; push on, οὐδὲν ἠδύνατο π. τῶν ἔργων Plb. 5.100.1:— Pass., to be developed, improved, of machines, Hero Bel. 74.4.
push forward, advance, τὸ ὑπερκείμενον τοῦ κρημνοῦ (by building a wall) D.S. 4.78; exalt, τὴν πατρίδα Plb. 9.10.4; τινὰ ἐς τὰς ἀρχάς promote him, D.C. l.c.; δύναμιν Phld. Rh. 1.40 S.
teach, τινάς τι LXX De. 6.7, cf. Plu. Cat.Mi. 36 (dub.); put forward as a representative, Act.Ap. 19.33 (v.l.):— Pass., to be instructed or egged on, ὑπὸ τῆς μητρός Ev.Matt. 14.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: Plb. 10.44.1, Aristid. 2.231 J.

children.label: III
children.definition: mount before, ἄλλην Arist. HA 546a10.
leading forward, advancing, Nicom. Harm. 12.
advancing, Artem. 2.12.
eat first, ἢν -βεβρώκῃ ὥνθρωπος Aret. SA 2.2:— Pass., προβρωθέντα φύλλα Dsc. 3.45, cf. 1.125.
previous ( i.e. antenatal) existence, Plu. Fr. 7.9, Porph. Gaur. 11.4, Id. ap. Stob. 2.8.42, Hierocl. Prov. p.172 B., al., Herm. in Phdr. p.109A.

live before, mostly pf. part. Pass., τὰ προβεβιωμένα oneʼs previous life, Plb. 11.2.9, J. AJ 4.8.15, Plu. Vind. 2.561a, Hdn. 2.1.8, Plot. 3.4.5, cf. Plu. Lib.educ. 2.10b; also pf. Act. in intr. sense, τὸν προβεβιωκότα χρόνον IG 12(5).655.10 ( Syros).
having had a prior existence, οὐ π. [ἡ ψυχὴ] τοῦ σώματος ἔσται Sophon. in de An. 135.1.
shoot or sprout before, Thphr. CP 5.1.12, Ph. 1.602; π. πρότερον τῶν λοιπῶν Thphr. CP 1.13.12; shoot before the season, Plu. Isid. 2.377c.
previous shoot, Thphr. CP 5.2.2.

senses.definition: Lyc. 577 ( ἐπεί, ὅταν βλαστάνωσιν αἱ ἄμπελοι . . , θύουσιν αὐτῷ, Sch.).

children.definition: able to foresee, τῶν μελλόντων Eust. 83.33.

foresee, ὅτι ἥξει ἡ ἡμέρα LXX Ps. 36(37).13; provide against, D.H. 11.20; λογισμῷ μηδὲν π. Heraclit. Incred. 11; τῇ ψυχῇ προβλέπειν Him. Or. 31.1; provide, θανάτου μνημόσυνον IG 12(8).561 ( Thasos):— Med., θεοῦ περὶ ἡμῶν τι προβλεψαμένου Ep.Hebr. 11.40.
anything thrown forward or projecting, πόντου π. ἁλίκλυστον sea-washed promontory, S. Aj. 1219 (lyr.).
hindrance, obstacle, Hp. Nat.Mul. 67, Mul. 1.20, Ael. NA 2.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: anything put before one as a defence, bulwark, barrier, προβλήματα ἀντʼ ἀσπίδων ἐποιεῦντο γεράνων δοράς Hdt. 7.70, cf. 4.175; τῶν . . π. τὰ μὲν πρὸς τὸν πόλεμον ὁπλίσματα, τὰ δὲ φράγματα Pl. Plt. 279d sq., cf. Sph. 261a; σώματος π., of a shield, A. Th. 540; νεῶν προβλήματα, of a wall, E. Rh. 213; χαλκᾶ προβλήματα the brazen armour of horses, X. Cyr. 6.1.51.

data.quote: προβλήματα ἀντʼ ἀσπίδων ἐποιεῦντο γεράνων δοράς
τῶν . . π. τὰ μὲν πρὸς τὸν πόλεμον ὁπλίσματα, τὰ δὲ φράγματα

children.definition: defence against a thing, αἰχμῆς καὶ πέτρων A. Th. 676; χείματος προβλήματα E. Supp. 208; π. χειμώνων Pl. Ti. 74b; π. κακῶν Ar. V. 615; κρύους π. ποιοῦνται τὴν ἐσθῆτα Plu. QConv. 2.691d; but,
μηδὲν φόβου π. μηδʼ αἰδοῦς ἔχειν to have neither fear nor reverence as a defence, S. Aj. 1076; τὸν ποταμὸν π. λαβεῖν, ποιήσασθαι, Plb. 2.66.1, 3.14.5.

children.label: III
children.definition: anything put forward as an excuse, π. τοῦ τρόπου D. 45.69; λαβὼν π. σαυτοῦ παῖδα making a screen of him, S. Ph. 1008.

children.label: IV
children.definition: task. business, E. El. 985, Gal. 11.250.
problem in Geometry, etc., Pl. R. 530b, Tht. 180csq., Plu. Marc. 14, 19, etc.; φυσικὰ π. Epicur. Ep. 2p.36U.; οἱ κατὰ πρόβλημα λόγοι (opp. τὰ ἐν τῷ βίῳ) theoretical, Phld. Lib. p.59 O.

Arist., question as to whether a statement is so or not, Arist. Top. 101b28, cf. 104b1: τὰ π. title of work by Arist., cf. Mete. 363a24, PA 676a18, GA 747b5, cf. προβληματικός; also of the extant work wrongly ascribed to Arist.
problem, εἰς π. παμμέγεθες ἐνέπεσε Plb. 28.13.9; εὕροντο λύσιν τοῦ π. Id. 30.19.5; ἐν προβλήμασιν ἢ κρίνομεν ἢ βουλευόμεθα Hermog. Inv. 1.1.

data.quote: ἐν προβλήμασιν ἢ κρίνομεν ἢ βουλευόμεθα

children.definition: riddle, π. προβάλλειν LXX Jd. 14.12.
of or for a problem: τὰ π. title of work by Arist. (cf. πρόβλημα IV.3), Somn.Vig. 456a29.

definition: προβλημάτιον, τό, Dim. of πρόβλημα, Arr. Epict. 2.20.33, Gloss.

children.definition: framing problems or riddles, Tz. H. 2.518.
of or for the construction of fortifications, Poll. 7.207; -κή (sc. τέχνη), ἡ, ibid.; ἡ π. δύναμις the faculty of constructing them, Pl. Plt. 280d.
problematical, Plu. Cat.Mi. 25.

thrown forward, jutting out, προβλῆτι σκοπέλῳ Il. 2.396; πέτρῃ ἔπι προβλῆτι 16.407; στήλας τε προβλῆτας 12.259; ἀκταὶ προβλῆτες ἔσαν Od. 5.405, cf. 10.89, 13.97, Archil. 49 Diehl; προβλῆτες, without subst., forelands, headlands, S. Ph. 936; τόν γε (sc. ποταμόν) εἴργουσιν π. Q.S. 10.175: sg., Opp. H. 5.252; π. ἔπαλξις, ἐρίπνα, AP 5.293.3 ( Agath.), 7.147 ( Arch.); π. γενειάς Nonn. D. 15.8; προσώπου π. γένυς Ib. 28.75; γναθμοῖς π. ὀδόντες ib. 26.301: in later Prose, προβλῆτες λιμένων πύργοι LXX 4 Ma. 13.6; λιμένες προβλῆσι λίθοις εἰς τὸ πέλαγος ἐξανεστηκότες Aristid. Or. 25(43).3; ὀφρύες π. Aret. SD 2.13.

data.quote: λιμένες προβλῆσι λίθοις εἰς τὸ πέλαγος ἐξανεστηκότες

children.definition: productive, τινος Simp. in Ph. 1138.32, Gloss.

definition: προβλῆτις, ιδος, fem. of προβλής, Sch. Opp. H. 3.460.

children.definition: thrown forth or away, κυσὶν π. cast to the dogs, S. Aj. 830.

children.label: II
children.definition: spread, beaten out into plates, ἀργύριον prob.l. in LXX Je. 10.5(9).
producer, Gloss.

go or come forth, go out of the house, δμῳὰς δʼ οὐκ εἴας προβλωσκέμεν Od. 19.25; ὁ δὲ προμολών 4.22, cf. 24.388, Il. 21.37; μή τι θύραζε προβλώσκειν Od. 21.239, cf. Opp. H. 2.252: c.gen., προβλώσκειν μεγάρων Orph. Fr. 270.6.
shout before, cry aloud, τώ γε προβοῶντε μάχην ὤτρυνον (v. προβαίνω init.) Il. 12.277, cf. S. Ph. 218 (lyr.).
hasten to aid before, προβοηθῆσαι ἐς τὴν Βοιωτίην Hdt. 8.144 (v.l. προσβωθῆσαι).
held out before one, levelled, in rest, δούρατι προβολαίῳ Theoc. 24.125; προβόλαιος alone, = πρόβολος II, εἴσω τὸν π. ἔχων Orac. ap. Hdt. 7.148.

definition: προβολάριος, ὁ, dub. sens. in BGU 14 v 18 (iii A.D.).

children.definition: producer, originator, Procl. in Cra. p.2 P., Gloss.

putting forward, esp. of a weapon for defence, τὰ δόρατα εἰς προβολὴν καθιέναι to bring the spears to the rest, couch them, X. An. 6.5.25 (nisi leg. προσβολήν) ; [τὰ δόρατα] ἀποτεῖναι ἐς π. Arr. An. 1.6.2; κοντοὺς ὀρθοὺς ὡς ἐς π. φέροντες Id. Tact. 43.2; ἵστανται ἐς π. ib. 36.3; ἐν προβολᾷ θεμένα ξίφος bringing it to the guard, AP 7.433 ( Tymn.); ὁπλίτας ἑστῶτας ἐν π. standing with spear in rest, Plu. Caes. 44, cf. Plb. 2.65.11; ὑπελθεῖν τὴν π. τοῦ πολεμίου get under his guard, D.H. 3.19; of a pugilist, δοχμὸς ἀπὸ π. κλινθείς Theoc. 22.120; παγκρατίου προβολὰν διδάξαι IG 42(1).122.53 ( Epid., iv B.C.), cf. 7.2470.3 ( Thebes, iv/iii B.C.); Carneades προβολὴν pugilis . . similem facit ἐποχῇ Cic. Att. 13.21.3; ἀνέχοντες ἐν π. τὰς χεῖρας, of long-distance runners, Philostr. Gym. 32; ἡ π. τῶν χειρῶν, of boxers, ib. 34; αἱ π. τοῦ σώματος X. Cyn. 10.22; ἡ τῆς φάλαγγος π. the phalanx with its pikes couched, Plb. 18.30.1; αἱ τῶν θυρεῶν π. Id. 1.22.10, cf. Arr. Tact. 37.5; of the legs, putting foremost, Arist. IA 706a6.

data.quote: κοντοὺς ὀρθοὺς ὡς ἐς π. φέροντες
Carneades προβολὴν pugilis . . similem facit ἐποχῇ

children.definition: putting forth, βλαστοῦ Gp. 5.25.1.
putting forward of a plea or case, Hermog. Stat. 4, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: projection, prominence, ἡ π. τοῦ χείλεος Hp. Art. 8, etc.; τῆς κεφαλῆς a prominence of the skull, Id. VC 1; τῆς γλώσσης Aret. SA 1.7; π. ἀπὸ τοῦ χείλεος, of an elephantʼs trunk, Id. SD 2.13, cf. Ael. NA 5.41.

jutting rock, foreland, or tongue of land, S. Ph. 1455 (anap., prob. for προβλής) ἐπὶ προβολῇσι θαλάσσης Q.S. 9.378, cf. D.P. 1013, Plb. 1.53.10; Νειλορύτου δῶρον ἀπὸ π., i.e. from the Delta of the Nile, AP 9.350 ( Leon. Alex.); also the spur of a hill, Plu. Crass. 22.
head of a spear or κέστρος II, Plb. 18.29.3, 27.11.2.
projecting bridge, Id. 3.46.4.
projection of a weapon from the soldierʼs body, Ael. Tact. 14.3.
advanced body of cavalry, Arr. Tact. 40.2, al.
rope for lowering buckets, PFlor. 153 (iii A.D.), etc.

children.label: III
children.definition: thing held before one as a defence, screen, bulwark, π. μεγάλη τῆς χώρας X. Mem. 3.5.27; of the eyebrows, Id. Cyn. 5.26; τοῦ ὄμματος Arist. GA 780b23; ὅπως ᾖ π. τοῖς . . σπλάγχνοις [τὸ νῶτον] Id. PA 672a17: c.gen. objecti, defence against . . , δείματος π. καὶ βελέων S. Aj. 1212 (lyr.); θανάτου E. Or. 1488 (lyr.); καυμάτων Pl. Ti. 74b; τοῦ ἡλίου, τῶν ἀνέμων, τοῦ ψύχους, Thphr. CP 2.7.4, 3.10.4, 5.13.3; πρὸς τοὺς χειμῶνας ib. 3.7.2.

data.quote: ὅπως ᾖ π. τοῖς . . σπλάγχνοις [τὸ νῶτον]

children.definition: protection, τὰ προβολῆς ἕνεκα εἰργασμένα Pl. Plt. 288b; π. ἔχειν, of plants, Thphr. CP 3.20.5; προβεβλημένοι τὴν γαμικὴν π. Dam. Isid. 160.
front of a horseʼs hoof, Hippiatr. 123.

children.label: IV
children.definition: proposal of a personʼs name for election, Pl. Lg. 765b, SIG 976.10 ( Samos, ii B.C.), CPR 20.8 (iii A.D.), Cod.Just. 10.11.8.4, al., Ps.- Ptol. Centil. 83.

children.label: V
children.definition: presentation of a case to the assembly, D. 21.193: pl., ib. 11, Lex ib. 8, 10; τῶν συκοφαντῶν π. ἐποιησάμεθα Aeschin. 2.145, cf. X. HG 1.7.35, Isoc. 15.314, Arist. Ath. 43.5, 59.2, Harp. s.v. καταχειροτονία.

children.label: VI
children.definition: advance, loan, PSI 6.666.10 (iii B.C.); π. εἰς τὸ ζῆν financial provision, means of livelihood, gloss on ἀφορμή, Sch. E. Med. 342.
liable to a προβολή V, IG 5(1).1145.53 ( Gythium).
Aeol. for προβουλεύω I.2, IG 12(2).526d4 ( Eresos).

definition: προβόλιον, τό, Dim. of sq. II,

children.definition: boar-spear, X. Cyn. 10.1, Philostr. Im. 1.2 codd. ( προβοβίῳ Benndorf), 28: metaph., Hyp. Fr. 167.

children.label: II
children.definition: basket, Hsch.
anything that projects:

children.label: I
children.definition: jutting rock, foreland, ἐπὶ προβόλῳ Od. 12.251: metaph., boulder in the path, obstacle, προβόλοις προσπταίειν interpol. in D. 8.61; λιμένας προβόλων ἐνέπλησας Id. 25.84 (metaph.; also literally, of stones sunk in a harbour, Arr. An. 2.21.7); τὸν λογισμὸν ὡς π. ἐμποδὼν τῇ γλώττῃ κείμενον Plu. Garr. 2.510a.

data.quote: τὸν λογισμὸν ὡς π. ἐμποδὼν τῇ γλώττῃ κείμενον

children.definition: πρόβολοι ξύλων projecting barriers of wood to break the force of a stream, Id. Caes. 22.
defence, bulwark, π. πολέμου, of a fortress, X. Cyr. 5.3.11 and 23; of a person, shield, guardian, π. ἐμός, σωτὴρ δόμοις Ar. Nu. 1161 (lyr., paratrag.).

children.label: II
children.definition: hunting-spear, Hdt. 7.76; generally, missile, Ph. Bel. 84.11 (pl.).
eligible for nomination (cf. προβάλλω A.II.4), PThead. 17.9 (iv A.D.).
plate, dish, Ph. 2.547.
means of providing food:

children.label: I
children.definition: trunk, Arist. PA 659a15, Phylarch. 36J., Plb. 3.46.12, Agatharch. 71, Str. 15.1.43.

children.label: b
children.definition: proboscis, Arist. HA 528b29.

children.label: II
children.definition: tentacles of the decapod cephalopoda, ib. 523b30, PA 685a33.
assistant herdsman, Hdt. 1.113 (v.l. προβόσκων).
office of πρόβουλος, Papers of Amer. Sch.at Athens 3 No. 428 (Asia Minor).
preliminary decree of the senate, to be laid before the Ecclesia, Eup. 73 (dub.), D. 18.9, 24.11, Aeschin. 3.125.

children.label: II
children.definition: = Lat. senatusconsultum, D.H. 6.67, 7.38.

definition: προβουλευμάτιον, τό, Dim. of foreg., Luc. Par. 42, Alciphr. 3.22.

children.definition: previous deliberation, Sch.rec. Pi. O. 7.79.

contrive or concert measures before, ὅπως μηδὲν δεήσει Th. 3.82; ὅπως ἂν ῥήϊστα ἐσχηματισμένος ᾖ Hp. Art. 52; opp. μετανοέω, Democr. 66 ( Med.); μὴ προβουλεύσας without premeditation, Arist. EN 1135b20:— Med., debate, consider first, τι Hdt. 1.133: abs., X. Cyr. 4.3.17, Arist. EN 1135b10; πρὸς ἕκαστα Hp. Prog. 1:— Pass., τὸ προβεβουλευμένον Arist. EN 1112a15.

βουλή at Athens and elsewh., frame or pass a προβούλευμα, X. HG 1.7.7; ἡ βουλὴ ταῦτα προὐβεβουλεύκει D. 19.34; ἐξιέναι τοὺς ἱππέας προεβούλευσεν ἡ βουλή Id. 21.162; τὴν βουλὴν προβουλεύσασαν ἐξενεγκεῖν εἰς τὸν δῆμον IG 1(2).66.17, 110.37; of a board of πρόβουλοι, π. περί τινος Th. 8.1, Arist. Pol. 1298b30; of the Spartan γερουσία, Plu. Agis 11; τὸ προβεβουλευμένον, = Lat. senatusconsultum, Plb. 6.16.2: impers. in Pass., προβεβούλευται ὅπως ἂν . . it has been decreed that . . , Ar. Ec. 623; τῇ βουλῇ προβεβ., c.acc. et inf., X. HG 7.1.2.

data.quote: ἐξιέναι τοὺς ἱππέας προεβούλευσεν ἡ βουλή
τὴν βουλὴν προβουλεύσασαν ἐξενεγκεῖν εἰς τὸν δῆμον

children.definition: award by a προβούλευμα, τούτων τῶν προβεβουλευμένων . . δωρειῶν D. 18.53.

children.label: II
children.definition: to have the chief voice in counsel, X. Cyr. 8.7.9.

children.label: III
children.definition: π. τινός deliberate for one, provide for his interest, Ar. Eq. 1342, X. An. 3.1.37; τοῦ δήμου for or before the people, Arist. Pol. 1299b33.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Med., make up oneʼs mind beforehand, prejudge a case, Hp. Fract. 1.
forethought, ἐκ προβουλῆς of malice aforethought, Antipho 1.5, D.C. 47.4, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: standing committee, ἡ βουλὴ καὶ ἡ π. dub. in BCH 26.168 ( Syria, i/ii A.D.).
meeting of πρόβουλοι, Sch. Il. 2.194.

definition: προβουλόπαις, παιδος, f.l. for προβούλου παῖς, A. Ag. 386 (lyr.).

children.definition: deliberating beforehand or for others, Ἄτα prob. in A. Ag. 386 (lyr.): but usu.

children.label: II
children.definition: standing committee to examine measures before they were formally proposed to the people, Arist. Pol. 1298b29, 1299b31, 1322b16; at Megara, Ar. Ach. 755; Corinth, Nic.Dam. 60 J.; Corcyra, IG 9(1).682.12; Delphi, GDI 2642.26; of the ἀμνήμονες at Cnidus, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.292a; ἀπαγγέλλειν . . δήμου προβούλοις A. Th. 1011.
delegates of the twelve Ionian states at the Panionium, Hdt. 6.7; of delegates appointed to consult on the mode of meeting Xerxes, π. τῆς Ἑλλάδος Id. 7.172.
committee of Ten, appointed after the Sicilian defeat (cf. Th. 8.1), Decr. ap. Arist. Ath. 29.2, Ar. Lys. 421, Lys. 12.65, Arist. Rh. 1419a28.
shallow, τὰ π. Plb. 1.47.1.
the foot ⏑ - - - -, Diom. p.481 K.
soak beforehand, Arist. Pr. 931a14, Thphr. HP 3.17.2:— Pass., Hp. Steril. 224: aor. part. προβρᾰχείς Dsc. 3.6, Eup. 2.31.
former mortal, dub. in Epigr. ap. D.L. 8.45.
push up the wick of a lamp, trim it, cj. in Ar. V. 250: metaph., π. φορτικὸν γέλωτα Com.Adesp. 644.
before or in front of the altar, prob. in Pi. Pae. 9 Fr. 131; σφαγαί E. Ion 376: προβώμια, τά, space in front of an altar, Id. Heracl. 79.

children.label: II
children.definition: placed on the altar beforehand (as a preliminary sacrifice), Berl.Sitzb. 1927.161 ( Cyrene).
live with a woman before marriage, Str. 6.1.8:— Pass., of a woman, to be married before, τινι App. Syr. 68.

children.label: II
children.definition: marry first or before, Ph. 2.304, Plu. Alex. 70.
live in wedlock before or already, BGU 183.6 (i A.D.).
ante-nuptial, δωρεά Cod.Just. 5.1.6, cf. Tz.ad Lyc. 547.

children.label: II
children.definition: προγάμια (sc. ἱερά), τά, sacrifice before marriage, Poll. 3.38.
betrothed, νύμφαι Tryph. 341.

children.label: II
children.definition: before a marriage: Πρόγαμοι title of a play by Menander, Stob. 1.7.2.
cheer or comfort beforehand, Ph. 1.104, dub. cj. in 2.416 ( Pass., προς - codd.).
prepare oneself for tickling, Arist. EN 1150b22.
worn in front of the belly, ὅπλισις EM 589.12.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. προγαστρίδιον, τό, false paunch worn by actors, Luc. Salt. 27, JTr. 41.
Alex.Aphr. in Top. 421.30.
Philostr. Im. 2.26.
pot-bellied, Gerhard Phoinix p.6, Str. 4.4.6, App.Anth. 5.11, Luc. Nec. 11, Gal. 10.145, Adam. 2.31; of a pot-bellied bottle, Antiph. 224.6: Comp. προγαστρότερα Hp. Aër. 24.
smile before: metaph. of early morning, Ph. 1.603.
bearded, Theoc. 3.9, Longus 1.16.
Pempel. ap. Stob. 4.25.52.

born before, primeval, θεοί S. Ant. 938 (anap.): Comp. προγενέστερος, α, ον, earlier in birth, i.e. older, Il. 2.555, Od. 2.29, Theoc. 29.10, etc.; γενεῇ π. Il. 9.161; τινος 23.789; οἱ π. those who have gone before us, our predecessors, Arist. EN 1181b16, de An. 403b27, PA 642a24, Phld. Ind.Sto. 20: Sup. προγενέστατος, eldest-born, primordial, h.Cer. 110, Arist. de An. 410b14, Ath.Med. ap. Orib. inc. 21.21.

children.label: II
children.definition: previous, prior, συγγραφαί PSI 8.904.6 (i A.D.); χάρτης PLond. 1.77.59 ( Comp., vi A.D.).
beget before, Thphr. CP 1.20.3.
ancestress: mother, Lyc. 183.
forefathers, E. Hipp. 1380 (lyr.).
older, δὶς τῆς σῆς ἡλικίης π. BMus.Inscr. 829b2 ( Cnidus).
taste before, τινος Arist. de An. 422b7.
food taken before a meal, PKlein.Form. 261.5 (pl., vi A.D.).
one who tastes before, Plu. Bruta anim. 2.990a, Ath. 4.171b: fem. προ-γευστρίς, ίδος, ὄσφρησις Ph. 1.170, cf. 603.
give a foretaste of, c. gen., Aristid. Quint. 3.27:— Med., taste before, Anaxil. 10 (prob. cj.), Arist. PA 690b27, Plu. Adul. 2.49e; τοῦ μέλλοντος ἀγαθοῦ Ph. 1.603.
measure, survey beforehand, PTeb. 151 ( ii B.C., Pass.), etc.
cultivate earlier or already, BGU 462.18 (ii A.D.), POxy. 101.8 ( Pass., ii A.D.), etc.
previous cultivator, Sammelb. 5672.28 (ii A.D.).
rejoice before, Ph. 1.602.
grow old before, τοῦ χρόνου τοῦ ἱκνευμένου Hp. Aër. 7: abs., Luc. Tim. 20.
grow prematurely old, Id. Rh.Pr. 10, Sor. 1.87; ἐν τοῖς πόνοις Ph. 2.287.
prematurely old, Poll. 2.13.

definition: προγίγνομαι, Ion. and later προγίνομαι [ῑ]: fut. -γενήσομαι: aor. προὐγενόμην: pf. προγέγονα and -γεγένημαι:—

children.definition: come forward, οἱ δὲ τάχα προγένοντο quickly they came in sight, Il. 18.525, cf. h.Hom. 7.7; ἄμυδις προγένοντο Hes. Sc. 345; εἴσω π. Opp. H. 2.103; κόπρον ἔπι π. Call. Dian. 178, cf. Theoc. 25.134: c. gen., ὠκεανοῖο . . ὁπότε προγένωνται Ἰχθύες Arat. 706; ἀστὴρ ὑπὲρ τὸν ὁρίζοντα πρὸ ἁλίου προγενόμενος Ti.Locr. 97a.

data.quote: ἀστὴρ ὑπὲρ τὸν ὁρίζοντα πρὸ ἁλίου προγενόμενος

children.label: II
children.definition: to be born before, exist before, ἢν . . προγεγονότες ἔωσι πρὶν . . Hdt. 7.3; οἱ προγεγονότες θεοί Id. 2.146; οἱ π. ἄνθρωποι former men, X. Mem. 4.8.10; οἱ προγεγενημένοι Id. Cyr. 8.7.24, etc.; οἱ προγενόμενοι the previous crews, Plb. 10.17.12.

ταῦτά μοι προὐγεγόνει Pl. Smp. 219e; αἱ ἀκοαὶ τῶν προγεγενημένων reports of things of old time, Th. 1.20, etc.; τὰ προγεγονότα Hp. Prog. 1, etc.; προγεγενημένοι [πόλεμοι], καιροί, Th. 1.1, Decr.Byz. ap. D. 18.90; οἱ προγεγονότες ἡμῖν ἔμπροσθεν λόγοι Pl. Lg. 699e, cf. PHib. 1.96.8 (iii B.C.); αἱ διὰ τῆς ψυχῆς ἡδοναὶ πρὸ τῶν διὰ τοῦ σώματος προγίγνοιντʼ ἄν Pl. Phlb. 39d.

data.quote: αἱ διὰ τῆς ψυχῆς ἡδοναὶ πρὸ τῶν διὰ τοῦ σώματος προγίγνοιντʼ ἄν

children.label: III
children.definition: to be born, Man. 6.255, 336.

definition: προγιγνώσκω, Ion. and later προγῑνώσκω: fut. -γνώσομαι: Ep. aor. inf. προγνώμεναι h.Cer. 257:—

children.definition: know, perceive, learn, or understand beforehand, τι l.c.; τὰ στοιχεῖα Pl. Tht. 203d: abs., E. Hipp. 1072; π. ὅτι . . X. Eq.Mag. 8.12:—Medic., know before being told, declare unaided, τά τε παρεόντα καὶ τὰ προγεγονότα καὶ τὰ μέλλοντα ἔσεσθαι Hp. Prog. 1; τοὺς καιρούς Id. Aër. 2.

data.quote: τά τε παρεόντα καὶ τὰ προγεγονότα καὶ τὰ μέλλοντα ἔσεσθαι

children.definition: prognosticate, π. χειμῶνα αἱ μέλιτται Arist. HA 627b10.
foreknow, λαόν Ep.Rom. 11.2, al.
π. τῶν θεῶν learn things in advance of . . , Philostr. VA 8.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: judge beforehand, ἐς τὸ μέλλον καλὸν π. Th. 2.64; provide, τι X. Cyr. 2.4.11:— Pass., παρὰ τῷ διαιτητῇ προεγνωσμένος ἀδικεῖν judged beforehand to have done wrong, D. 29.58, cf. Inscr.Délos 502 A 12 (iii B.C.).
sweeten before, v.l. in Gal. 6.546 ( Pass.).
to be hasty of tongue, Hsch. s.v. λαβρεύεαι.
tip of the tongue, Poll. 2.105.
hasty of tongue, talkative, Ptol. Tetr. 165, Pythag. Ep. 12.2 ( Myia), Polem.Phgn. 37.

children.label: II
children.definition: πρόγλωσσον, τό, = προγλωσσίς, Ruf. ap. Orib. 25.1.23.
discerning beforehand, c.gen., Orph. Fr. 49.96.
apprehend before, Arist. Top. 141b12, Gal. 4.764.

definition: προγνωσία, ἡ, = sq., Sch. E. Hec. 1137.

children.definition: foreknowledge, LXX Ju. 9.6, Act.Ap. 2.23, 1 Ep.Pet. 1.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: perceiving beforehand, Plu. Pyth. 2.399d, Sollert. 982c, Luc. Alex. 8, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: prognosis of diseases, Κῳακαὶ π. title of work by Hp., cf. Gal. 16.490, 18(2).11, AP 11.382 ( Agath.); title of work by Democritus.

children.label: III
children.definition: prediction, Gem. 17.13, al.
skilled in prognosis, of physicians, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).176.

foreknowing, prescient, δύναμις Ph. 1.659, 2.164; μόριον . . τῆς ψυχῆς Plu. Def.orac. 2.433a; of persons, M.Ant. 8.25; esp. of astrologers, Vett.Val. 37.28, al.: c. gen., π. τῆς κινήσεως τῶν νοσημάτων Gal. 17(1).243: τὸ π. a sign of the future, prognostic, Gp. 1.2 tit.: προγνωστικόν, τό, name of a treatise by Hp.; also title of work by Epicurus, D.L. 10.28; but -κή, ἡ, name of an antidote, Damocr. ap. Gal. 14.134. Adv. -κῶς Gloss.
abavia, privigna, Gloss., v.l. in Ph. 2.303.

definition: προγονητικός, f.l. for sq., Aristid. Or. 30(10).24.

children.definition: derived from parentage, ἀφορμή Metrod. Herc. 831.15; ancestral, πράξεις, δόξα, ἀρετή, Plb. 3.64.2, 13.6.3, Ph. 2.444; πολιτεία, δυναστεία, LXX 2 Ma. 8.17, D.S. 17.24; κτήσεις Mitteis Chr. 31i22 (ii B.C.); σορός Judeich Altertümer von Hierapolis No.245.
showing ancestry, στέμμα IG 2(2).1357.30.
early-born, [ ἄρνες], opp. μέτασσαι, Od. 9.221, cf. Hermesian. 7.74, SIG 1038.9 ( Eleusis, iv/iii B.C.); first-born, IG 2.1301 (dub.).

children.label: II
children.definition: forefather, ancestor, Pi. O. 6.59; πατρός σου π. πατήρ E. Ion 267, cf. Hel. 15, Pl. Euthphr. 11b: freq. in pl., Pi. P. 9.105, A. Pers. 405, Hdt. 7.150, etc.; οἱ ἄνωθεν π. Pl. Mx. 236e; οἱ πάλαι π. Id. Ep. 359d; ἐκ προγόνων Id. Tht. 173d; also of gods or heroes who are the authors or founders of a race, A. Fr. 273, Hdt. 4.127, Pl. Smp. 186e, Isoc. 9.14, etc.; Ζεῦ πρόγονε E. Or. 1242; θεοὶ π. Pl. Euthd. 302d: also as fem., π. γυνή A. Supp. 533 (lyr.), cf. 43 (lyr.): metaph., οἱ π. the fathers or founders of a school, Luc. Herm. 15; τὸν π. τῆς ἐμαυτοῦ σοφίας Philostr. VA 8.7; ἰὼ πόνοι π. πόνων troubles parents of troubles, S. Aj. 1197 (lyr.).

children.label: III
children.definition: child by a former marriage, step-son, E. Ion 1329, D.H. Isoc. 18, Mon.Anc.Gr. 16.9, Luc. Cal. 26, Supp.Epigr. 6.667 ( Attalia), PFay. 48.3 (i A.D.), etc.: fem., step-daughter, Stratt. 79, Is. 12.5, Hyp. Fr. 10, D.S. 4.43, Plu. Pomp. 9; rarely προγόνη (q.v.): irreg. Sup. προγονέστατος eldest step-son, dub. in TAM 2(1).246.18 ( Sidyma).
public proclamation or notice, edict, PRev.Laws9.7 (iii B.C.), Plu. Galb. 5, Hdn. 4.9.4, D.C. 65.1, etc.; placard, notice, Luc. Herm. 11, POxy. 2108.6 (iii A.D.), PMasp. 353.4 (vi A.D.).
order of the day, agenda of βουλή or ἐκκλησία, D. 25.9, Arist. Ath. 44.2.
title of a prescription, Gal. 13.909; address of a letter, Procop.Gaz. Ep. 25.
injunction, advice, Gal. 17(2).141.
= foreg., OGI 441.130 ( Lagina, i B.C.), Sch. Ar. V. 55; ὑπογραμμὸν λέγομεν ἀντὶ τοῦ προγραμμόν Ammon. Diff. p.134 V.
public notice, advertisement, X. Eq.Mag. 4.9, Plb. 25.3.2, SIG 976.37 ( Samos, ii B.C.), OGI 515.38 ( Mylasa, iii A.D.); edict, D.C. 47.13; ἐκ προγραφῆς by edict, Id. 56.25.
notice of sale, Thphr. Fr. 97.2 (pl.), Plu. Apophth.reg. 2.205c; public sale of confiscated property, Str. 5.4.11.
ἐπὶ θανάτῳ προγραφαί proscriptions, App. BC 1.2; σφαγαὶ καὶ π. Plu. Brut. 27; warrant for arrest, BGU 372.8 ( ii A.D., pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: table drawn up in advance, of an astronomical cycle, D.S. 12.36.

children.label: III
children.definition: heading, preliminary form, BGU 780.2 (ii A.D.), Men.Prot. p.16D., etc.; title of a prescription, Gal. 13.777:— Dim. προγον-γράφιον [ᾰ], τό, Sammelb. 5273.10 (v A.D.).

write before or first, τὰς αἰτίας προὔγραψα πρῶτον Th. 1.23; write before or above, Ep.Eph. 3.3; αἱ προγεγραμμέναι λέξεις Hipparch. 1.7.5; κατὰ τὰ -γεγραμμένα PPetr. 3p.179 (iii B.C.); ὁ προγεγραμμένος ἀριθμός before-mentioned, Plu. An.procr. 2.1018c.
write as a copy, Poll. 4.18.

children.label: II
children.definition: set forth as a public notice, π. τι ἐν πινακίοις Ar. Av. 450; π. κρίσιν, δίκην τινί, give notice of a trial, D. 47.42, Plu. Cam. 11 ( Pass.); appoint or summon by public notice, ἐκκλησίας Aeschin. 2.60,61; χορηγοὺς π. appoint as choregi, Arist. Oec. 1352a1; π. τινὰ [κληρωθησόμενον τ]ῆς φυλῆς ἣν ἂν βούληται Supp.Epigr. 4.183.15 ( Halic., iii B.C.); π. τοὺς λειτουργήσοντας IG 5(1).1390.73, cf. 74 ( Pass., Andania, i B.C.); στρατιᾶς κατάλογον Plu. Cam. 39; φρουρᾶς ἡμῖν προγραφείσης D. 54.3; π. ὅσα δεῖ χρηματίζειν τὴν βουλήν Arist. Ath. 43.3; ἀπὸ τίνος ἄρχοντος καὶ ἐπωνύμου μέχρι τίνων δεῖ στρατεύεσθαι ib. 53.7; οἷς κατʼ ὀφθαλμοὺς . . Χριστὸς προεγράφη was proclaimed or set forth publicly, Ep.Gal. 3.1, cf. Supp.Epigr. 4.263.13, 15 ( Panamara, i A.D.):— Med., περὶ ὧν προεγράψατο εἰς τὴν βουλήν Milet. 6.43 (iii B.C.), cf. SIG 562.3 ( Paros, iii B.C.), etc.

data.quote: π. τινὰ [κληρωθησόμενον τ]ῆς φυλῆς ἣν ἂν βούληται
π. ὅσα δεῖ χρηματίζειν τὴν βουλήν
περὶ ὧν προεγράψατο εἰς τὴν βουλήν

children.definition: give written notice of sale, παρὰ τῇ ἀρχῇ Thphr. Fr. 97.1, cf. Plu. Apophth.reg. 2.205c; sell by auction, ἐν τῷ πραιτωρίῳ τὰ κτήματα D.C. 51.4.

= Lat. proscribere, π. τινὰς φυγάδας Plb. 32.5.12; οἱ προγεγραμμένοι the proscribed, ib. 6.1; οἱ π. ὑπὸ Σύλλα Str. 5.2.6; οἱ προγραφέντες D.C. 47.13; οἱ προγραφέντες ἐπὶ θανάτῳ Plu. Brut. 27: metaph., οἱ προγεγρ. εἰς τοῦτο τὸ κρίμα those whose names have been registered for condemnation, Ep.Jud. 4.

children.label: III
children.definition: write a name at the head of a list, π. τινὰ ἐπὶ τῶν ψηφισμάτων Plu. Demetr. 10; τῆς βουλῆς π . . . Μάρκον, of the censor, name Marcus princeps senatus, Id. Aem. 38, cf. Flam. 18:— Pass., προγράφεσθαι τοῦ συνεδρίου Id. Fort.Rom. 2.318c; προγεγραμμένος τῆς βουλῆς Id. TG 4.
remain awake first, in aor. part. -ήσαντες Gal. 11.311 (written προεγρηγορήσαντες in same context, Id. 19.519).

exercise, train beforehand, χέρα S. Fr. 498; ἑαυτὸν ἐς ἄλλον βίον Luc. Herm. 78, cf. Porph. VP 47: esp. train in oratory, Arr. Epict. 1.26.13, etc.:— Med., study, practise oneself, Gal. Anim.Pass. 2.3; but also, act as προγυμναστής 2, Id. 6.177:— Pass., of arguments or passages, to be prepared beforehand, οἱ προγυμνασθέντες λόγοι Hermog. Inv. 4.12.
previous exercise, βασιλείας Ph. 2.90, cf. Iamb. ap. Stob. 2.2.6.

definition: προγυμνάσιον [ᾰ], τό, = foreg., f.l. in Gal. 6.764.

children.definition: preparatory exercise, πολέμου for war, Ath. 14.631a; also in Rhetoric, Arist. Rh.Al. 1436a25: in pl., title of works by Aphthonius, etc.
trainer, Arr. Epict. 3.20.9, 4.4.31.
slave who goes through exercises with his master, Seneca Ep. 83.3, Gal. 6.187.
keep exposed, Gal. 10.416.

definition: προγωνία, ἡ, a garment worn by cooks, Hsch. (ante πρόγονοι).
προδαῆναι, aor. inf. Pass. (with act. sense) from *δάω,

children.definition: know beforehand, προϊδὼν ἠὲ προδαείς Od. 4.396; inf., A.R. 1.106: redupl. aor. προδέδαεν· προμεμάθηκεν, Hsch.
lend before or first, D.C. 51.17; τῷ Ἀπόλλωνι τὴν χάριν Luc. Sacr. 3:— Pass., ὁ εἰς τὴν γένεσιν [τῶν ἔργων] τῷ πόνῳ προδανεισθεὶς χρόνος Plu. Per. 13.

data.quote: ὁ εἰς τὴν γένεσιν [τῶν ἔργων] τῷ πόνῳ προδανεισθεὶς χρόνος

children.label: II
children.definition: advance money for public objects, ὅσοι ἂν προδανείσωσιν ἄτοκα OGI 46.5 ( Halic., iii B.C.), cf. IG 7.4254.38 ( Oropus, iv B.C.), etc.; τοῖς ἀπόροις χρήματα Arist. Ath. 16.2:— Med., χρήματα εἰς τὸ θεωρικόν, χρήματα τῷ δήμῳ εἰς τὴν διοίκησιν π., Hyp. Dem. Fr. 4.
advance of funds for public purposes, CIG (addend.) 2717b ( Stratonicea); τὸν π. ποιεῖσθαι Milet. 3 No.138.31 (iii B.C.).
one who advances money for public purposes, OGI 46.9 (pl., Halic., iii B.C.), IG ΙΙ(2).287 A 122 ( Delos, iii B.C.).
exhaust beforehand, τὸ μέγεθος τῆς χάριτος IG 7.2713.20 (Acraeph., Oratio Neronis):— Pass., ἐξουσία προδεδαπανημένη Luc. Abd. 11.
defray the expense of beforehand, ἐπισκευήν Sammelb. 5232.17 (i A.D.).
fear prematurely, S. OT 90.
before evening, π. ἔστιχεν Theoc. 25.223.

definition: προδείκνυμι ( προδεικνύω Hdt. 1.209, 7.37), 3 sg. προδίκνυτι [δῐ] Epigr. in GDI 5112 ( Crete): Ion. aor. -έδεξα (v. infr.):—

children.definition: show by example, by doing something first, προδέξαντες σχῆμα, οἷόν τι ἔμελλε εὐπρεπέστατον φανέεσθαι ἔχουσα Hdt. 1.60; τὸν ζωστῆρα προδέξας having shown [the way of] the girdle, Id. 4.10.

data.quote: προδέξαντες σχῆμα, οἷόν τι ἔμελλε εὐπρεπέστατον φανέεσθαι ἔχουσα

children.definition: tell first, A. Pr. 779, S. OT 624.

children.label: II
children.definition: foreshow what is about to happen, πάντα τὰ ἐπιφερόμενα Hdt. 1.209; Ἕλλησι π. ὁ θεὸς ἔκλειψιν τῶν πολίων Id. 7.37, cf. 6.27; προφαίνει καρπὸν . . μέχρι τοῦ προδεῖξαι μόνον Thphr. CP 1.13.10: c. acc. et inf., make known beforehand that . . , Th. 3.47; π. ὅτι . . Plu. Phoc. 28; προδεδειγμένου it having been already shown, A.D Synt. 336.16.

data.quote: Ἕλλησι π. ὁ θεὸς ἔκλειψιν τῶν πολίων
προφαίνει καρπὸν . . μέχρι τοῦ προδεῖξαι μόνον

children.label: III
children.definition: point before one, σκήπτρῳ π. γαῖαν, of a blind man, S. OT 456; π. τὸ τόξον put it out before one, Luc. Herc. 1, cf. Herm. 68; π. δελεάσματα hold out baits, Them. Or. 22.271c; π. χρεῶν ἀποκοπάς ib. 7.91c.
χερσὶ π. make feints with the hands, Theoc. 22.102; also in war, X. Eq.Mag. 8.24; π. τινὰς ἐπιβολάς Plb. 2.66.2; of the cuttle-fish, π. εἰς τὸ πρόσθεν Arist. HA 621b34.
pantomimic actor, D.S. 34/ 5.34.
fear beforehand, τι Hdt. 7.50, Lyc. 276.
dine or sup before, Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.226f.

definition: πρόδειπνον, τό, f.l. for Πρόδικον, Ath. 9.406e.

children.definition: on the tenth day before, GDI 5017 ( Crete).
foreshower, Hdt. 7.37.
begin by saluting, τινα Hld. 10.2 (prob.l. for προσδεξ-).
see beforehand, μόρον A. Pr. 250.
bind on before, Gloss.
moisten first, Dsc. 1.43 ( Pass.).

clear or manifest in front or beforehand, Alc. Oxy. 1789 Fr. 1 ii4, D. 15.30, etc.; ἐμβολὴ π. ἥτις γίνοιτʼ ἂν ἁρμόζουσα Hp. Art. 30, cf. E. Or. 190 (lyr.), Hyp. Epit. 8; οἱ π. [φόβοι] foreseen, Arist. EN 1117a19, cf. Is. 3.19, al.; τοῦ μὲν ὄντος π. τοῦ δὲ ἀγνοουμένου Isoc. 6.37; εἰ μὲν ἦν π. τὰ μέλλοντα D. 18.196; π. εἵλοντο θανάτους Plb. 6.54.4; πρόδηλον ἥδη ἦν, ὅτι . . X. HG 6.4.9, cf. Isoc. 2.42, Pl. Phdr. 238b, etc.; evident, καὶ τυφλῷ, φασι, πρόδηλον Polystr. p.8 W.; πρόδηλα γάρ [ἐστι], ὅτι . . μέλλουσι Hdt. 9.17, cf. X. Eq. 3.3; ἐκ προδήλου from a place in sight, in full view, S. El. 1429 (lyr.). Adv. -λως Aeschin. 1.182, Plu. Oth. 9; θανεῖν π. S. Aj. 1311.

data.quote: ἐμβολὴ π. ἥτις γίνοιτʼ ἂν ἁρμόζουσα
τοῦ μὲν ὄντος π. τοῦ δὲ ἀγνοουμένου
εἰ μὲν ἦν π. τὰ μέλλοντα

children.definition: Vett.Val. 92.22, al.

make clear beforehand, show plainly, Th. 6.34; τὰ μέλλοντα Plu. Pomp. 32:— Pass., Plb. 10.46.10, etc.; τὰ προδηλούμενα πρόσωπα the aforesaid persons, IG 12(7).239.23 ( Amorgos), cf. SIG 1234.4 ( Lycia), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: give instructions beforehand, τινι c. inf., Parth. 17.3.
declaring beforehand, prognostication, Plu. Pyth. 2.398d; giving notice in advance, Id. Mar. 19.
showing beforehand, τινος Pl. Def. 414b, Petos. ap. Vett.Val. 80.6, Rhetor. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).129.
create before, Phlp. in GA 61.14.
cross before others, τάφρον, ποταμόν, X. Eq. 8.3, Plu. Sollert. 2.968e: abs., D.S. 18.35, Plu. Pyrrh. 24, D.C. 41.47.

raise prejudices against beforehand, τινα Th. 6.75, Hyp. Lyc. 10; τὰς ἀντιθέσεις Aps. p.261 H.; accuse beforehand, Luc. Tox. 34:— Pass., τοῖς προδιαβεβλημένοις καὶ ἀνθρώποις καὶ πράγμασιν Arist. Rh. 1400a22, cf. 1418b14; also, to be prejudiced, Plu. Aud.poet. 2.37b.

data.quote: τοῖς προδιαβεβλημένοις καὶ ἀνθρώποις καὶ πράγμασιν

children.definition: demonstrate, establish before, Nicom. Ar. 1.3 ( Pass.).
carry across before, Gal. UP 9.8.
discrediting in advance, Aps. pp. 242,247 H.
soak before, Sor. 1.57, Gal. 6.821.
perceive or understand beforehand, Th. 1.78.

children.label: II
children.definition: determine beforehand, Id. 5.38, J. AJ 8.12.3; μηδὲν π. not to prejudge anything, D.C. 52.31; προδιεγνωσμένη δίκη J. AJ 17.5.3.
previous recognition of the imminence of disease, Hp. Vict. 1.2, 3.69.
detailed prediction, Hp. Aph. 2.19 (pl.).
portray beforehand, ἡ φήμη π. τὴν σὴν χάριν Aristaenet. 1.26.

data.quote: ἡ φήμη π. τὴν σὴν χάριν

children.label: II
children.definition: pay beforehand, Inscr.Cos 28 (dub. rest.).
previous passing through, διʼ ἀργίλου Plu. Aet. phys. 2.913c.
contend previously, πρός τινα D.S. 31.8.
disseminate before, φήμην κατά τινος Plb. 38.17.2.

definition: προδιαζεύγνυμι: Gramm., σχῆμα προδιεζευγμένον (also called Ἀλκμανικόν), a figure used by Alcman, when a predicate or attribute belonging to two words

children.definition: is joined to the first, as ἐγὼ ἤλθομεν καὶ σύ, Sch. Od. 10.513.
pay or advance money, POxy. 180 (iii A.D.).
warm through before, in Pass., Gal. 7.187.
predisposition, Phld. Mus. p.63 K.(pl.), Anon.Lond. 24.33, S.E. P. 1.100 (pl.); previous state, Dsc. Alex.Praef. (pl.).
one must divide first, Olymp. in Phlb. p.266S.
divide beforehand, τὰς φλέβας Orib. Fr. 22.
Med., warn, τινὶ ὅπως . . PCair.Zen. 230.7 (iii B.C.).
prepare by diet, Ath.Med. ap. Orib. inc. 7.1 ( Pass.), Gal. 19.710, Hippiatr. 14, Alex.Trall. 1.17.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., submit a case to arbitration first, SIG 364.87 ( Ephesus, iii B.C.).
preparation by regimen, Luc. Nec. 7.
clear up a matter previously, Sor. 1.44 ( Pass.).
burn completely before, Heras ap. Gal. 13.423 ( Pass.), Crito ap. eund. 13.37 ( Pass.).
hold first, ἐν ταῖς ἀγκάλαις Sor. 1.106.
to be in a certain condition or state before, τῇ γνώμῃ Arr. Epict. 3.21.14.
evacuate completely first, Aët. 8.50.
make a hole in a radish first, Orib. Fr. 81 ( Pass.), Aët. 3.120 ( Pass.).
set in motion before, τινας J. AJ 15.5.2; νεῦρα Gal. 18(1).441.
previous setting in motion, Sor. 1.106.
wash out oneʼs mouth first, ἐλαίῳ Aët. 13.23.
serve before, J. AJ 18.3.4.
occupy before, J. BJ 4.2.3 ( Pass.).

children.label: II
children.definition: judge and decide beforehand, περί τινος, ὑπέρ τινος, Plb. 9.31.2, 27.6.3; π. ὅτι . . Id. 11.1.3: c. inf., προδιειληφὼς ἀποτρίβεσθαι τὰς διαλύσεις Id. 5.29.4: abs., Id. 2.2.10:— Pass., προδιειλήφθω let it be assumed beforehand, Hipparch. 2.1. 15.
explain beforehand, ὅτι . . Ptol. Geog. 1.2.2.
discuss before, Nicom. Ar. 1.3 ( Pass.); ἐν τοῖς προδιειλεγμένοις A.D. Pron. 37.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., with aor. Pass., speak, converse beforehand, περί τινος Isoc. 12.6; τισι with . . , PSI 4.360.15 (iii B.C.), D.H. 3.71; ταῖς πόλεσι Plu. Pyrrh. 22: abs., μικρὰ πάνυ προδιαλεχθείς Isoc. 12.199, cf. D.S. 20.7.
part., D.C. Fr. 87.4.
conversing beforehand, Gloss.
one must presume, Hipparch. 1.3.2, 2.1.23.
preliminary explanation, Ptol. Alm. 1.9.
reconcile first, αὑτοῖς τὴν θεόν Lib. Ref. 2.2.
discuss previously, Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.129.
previous casting up of accounts, PTeb. 89.2, al. (ii B.C.).
dissolve or break up before, τὰς τάξεις Plb. 11.16.2; τὴν γῆν Plu. QConv. 2.640e:— Pass., Arist. Pr. 934b6.
relax previously, λεπτυνούσῃ διαίτῃ Gal. 18(2).462.
dilute previously, ὕδατι Asclep. (?) ap. Gal. 12.586.
mitigate first, Gal. 14.693.
refute by anticipation, Lib. Decl. 49 intr. 5.
call to witness or invoke beforehand, τινας Plb. 24.10.6 (v.l. προσδιαμαρτύρομαι).
chew first, Archig. ap. Gal. 12.876.
take an interval of rest beforehand, Diocl. Fr. 141.
think over before, premeditate, Charond. ap. Stob. 4.2.24; μηδὲν -νοηθείς without premeditation, Arist. MM 1188b30; ὅσα ὁ Ζεὺς π. Plu. Fac.lun. 2.942a.
to be exhausted beforehand, λόγος dub.l. in Ath. 5.185a.
accomplish beforehand: Pass., προδιήνυστο D.C. 79.8.
send on as a messenger, τινα Plb. 8.18.3; send a message in advance, πρός τινα Id. 16.27.1: abs., Id. 21.4.7.
err through haste, Stoic. 3.147.
mould, fashion beforehand, παραδείγματα Him. Or. 12.2:— Pass., Ph. 2.146.
sail across first, ἐς τὴν ἤπειρον ἐπί τινα D.C. 47.33.
to be well trained before, of dogs, Poll. 5.51.
to be questioned or discussed before, A.D. Synt. 229.11.
enucleate beforehand, Ph.Bybl. ap. Eus. PE 1.9, S.E. M. 1.96, 11.18.
preliminary analysis, θεωρήματος Simp. in Cat. 60.3.
to be enumerated before, Apollon.Cit. 1.
plunder before, J. BJ 2.18.8, D.C. 37.14.
shake beforehand, περιπάτῳ ἢ αἰώρᾳ τὸ σωμάτιον Agathin. ap. Orib. 10.7.15.

explain beforehand, A.D. Synt. 97.9:— Pass., to be published or made plain beforehand, J. BJ 7.5.3, Gal. 13.698; αἱ -ούμεναι χῶραι the aforesaid . . , Cumont Fouilles de Doura-Europos 298, cf. SIG 685.56 ( Magn. Mae., ii B.C.).

definition: προδιασάφησις [σᾰ], f.l. for προσδιασάφησις, Zonae. p.166S.

children.definition: stir beforehand:— Pass., of intuitions, Dam. Pr. 29.
cause to putrefy first, Gal. 17(1).735.
examine well beforehand, Gal. 17(1). 148: aor. inf. -σκέψασθαι Id. Protr. 9: pf. -εσκέφθαι Id. 7.418.
revision or interpolation further back, Sch. Il. 24.109.
cleanse thoroughly first, Gal. 15.690 ( Pass.).
disseminate beforehand, λόγον Arist. Ath. 14.4.

open out first, τὸ στόμιον Sor. 1.69; distinguish before, Tz. in An.Ox. 3.317:— Med., forecast, τὸ ἐκβησόμενον Hp. Decent. 11; give an explanation before, premise, J. AJ 4.8.4, Dsc. Eup. 1 Praef., etc.; make a previous agreement with, τινι Ath. 12.521a; send a summons previously, τισὶ ἐκχωρεῖν PFlor. 55.19 (i A.D.): f.l. for προσ- in Ph. 1.677, A.D. Synt. 285.17.
narrate before, Sch. Il. 2.718.
pull to pieces, ridicule beforehand, Arist. Rh. 1418b9, Rh.Al. 1433b9.
tie up, compress first, Orib. 45.17.7.
arrange beforehand, prob.l. (for προσ-) in Aen.Tact. 16.16.
fix in position beforehand, τὴν κάτω γένυν Gal. 18(1).461.
cut through beforehand, Gal. 18(2).438.
arrange beforehand, ὅπως . . Aristaenet. 1.5.
predispose, esp. favourably, τινὰ οἰκείως ἔχειν J. AJ 12.4.3; τὸν ἀκροατήν Men.Rh. p.443 S.; but also of those who create prejudice, Suid. s.v. ἀμύνασθαι.
spend time on or study first, τῇ ῥητορικῇ Phld. Rh. 1.223 S.
sift beforehand, πυρόν Gal. 18(1).470.
express by a type beforehand, prefigure, Ph. 1.103:— Pass., ib. 4.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be sketched in outline first, Ptol. Tetr. 16, Olymp. in Mete. 184.10.
ruin, destroy beforehand, ναῦς ταῖς ἐμβολαῖς Plb. 16.6.13:— Pass., Th. 1.119, 6.78: c. gen., Lib. Or. 22.32.

children.label: II
children.definition: corrupt, demoralize beforehand, τοὺς κριτάς prob. for προσ- in D. 21.18; ἡγεμόνας Plb. 5.4.11:— Pass., Isoc. Ep. 2.8.
Pass., of milk, go bad beforehand, Sor. 1.88.
smear, anoint previously, τὰς ῥῖνας Dsc. 3.78.
to have a previous separation or difference with another, Arist. Rh. 1373a19.

teach beforehand, τινά τι S. Aj. 163 (anap.), Ar. Nu. 476; τινα Pl. Euthd. 302c, Grg. 489d, Hp.Ma. 291b: c. acc. et inf., π. τινὰ σοφὸν εἶναι S. Ph. 1015, cf. D. 51.12; [ ἀηδὼν] νεοσσὸν ᾄδειν π. Plu. Sollert. 2.973b:— Med., S. Tr. 681, Ar. Pl. 687:— Pass., learn beforehand, Th. 2.40.

give beforehand, pay in advance, X. HG 1.5.7, IG 2(2).1304.34; προεδίδου cj. for προσ- in Plb. 8.15.7; προδιδούς, opp. ἐπιδιδούς, Gal. 12.174; give first, Ep.Rom. 11.35:— Pass., Arist. Oec. 1350a36; τῶν -δεδομένων τιμῶν Inscr.Prien. 107.17, cf. GDI 5181.34 ( Crete); of a menu-tablet, Ath. 2.49d.

children.label: II
children.definition: give up, [ κλῆρον] PPetr. 3p.96 (iii B.C.); deliver up, τοὺς ὁμοκωμήτας ἡμῖν PThead. 17.16 (iv A.D.): most freq., give up to the enemy, betray, τοὺς λοιποὺς τοῖσι Σαμίοισι Hdt. 6.23; τὸ σὸν θνητοῖσι π. γέρας A. Pr. 38, etc.; π. τὴν Ποτείδαιαν Hdt. 8.128; τὰν φυγάδα A. Supp. 420 (lyr.); ἱκέτας E. Heracl. 246; πυργώματα A. Th. 251; τὰς πύλας, φρούριον, Ar. Av. 766, Ra. 362; of a woman, π. τὸ σῶμα Lys. Fr. 90: c. inf., ὃν σὺ προὔδωκας θανεῖν E. Or. 1588, cf. Alc. 659:— Pass., προδοθέντες ὑπὸ Σιτάλκεω ἥλωσαν Hdt. 7.137; ἀπόλωλα τλήμων, προδέδομαι S. Ph. 923.

forsake, abandon, οἵ με φίλοι προὔδωκαν Thgn. 813; π. τὴν Ἑλλάδα Hdt. 9.7.βʹ, Ar. Pax 408; μηδαμῶς . . προδῷς με Id. Th. 229; τὴν μητέρα π. Antipho 1.5; τὴν πολιτείαν Pl. Lg. 762c; σαυτόν Id. Cri. 45c:— Pass., προδεδόμεθα ὑπὸ τῶν συμμάχων Hdt. 9.60, cf. Vett.Val. 78.19.

play false, desert, Hdt. 5.113, 6.15, etc.; οὔτοι προδώσει χρησμός will not prove traitor, A. Ch. 269; χάρις . . προδοῦσʼ ἁλίσκεται S. Aj. 1267; ἢν προδιδῶσι πρὸς τοὺς κατιόντας treat treasonably with them, Hdt. 3.45: c. acc. cogn., προδοσίαν π. to be guilty of treachery, Din. 1.10.

betray, fail one, [ αἱ κάτω πλίνθοι] π. τὰς ἄνω X. HG 5.2.5; ὁ ὀφθαλμὸς π. τινά D. 52.13: intr., fail, of wine, Xenoph. 1.5; of a river, run dry, Hdt. 7.187; of a barricade that has proved useless, Id. 8.52.

data.quote: αἱ κάτω πλίνθοι] π. τὰς ἄνω

children.definition: surrender, give up, προδέδοται τὰ κρυπτά E. IA 1140; χάριν π. to be thankless, Id. Heracl. 1036; τὰ πράγματα Ar. Eq. 241; τὸ δοκοῦν ἀληθὲς οὐχ ὅσιον προδιδόναι Pl. R. 607c; τὸ δίκαιον Id. Lg. 907a; ἑτέροισι τὴν νίκην ib. 906e; καιρὸν τοῖς ἐναντίοις D. 19.6; to be false to, fail to uphold, ὅρκους X. Cyr. 5.1.22; τὴν καταχειροτονίαν D. 21.120; give up as lost, bid adieu to, ἡδονάς S. Ant. 1166; τὰς ἐλπίδας Ar. Nu. 1500; τὴν ἐκείνου προαίρεσιν D. 60.28; τὸν ἀγῶνα Aeschin. 1.115.

data.quote: τὸ δοκοῦν ἀληθὲς οὐχ ὅσιον προδιδόναι

children.definition: go out through before, X. Cyn. 5.4; of the motions of the bowels, Gal. 16.699.

children.label: II
children.definition: go through, explain before, πρὸς ὑμᾶς ὡς ἔχουσιν οἱ νόμοι Aeschin. 1.8.

data.quote: πρὸς ὑμᾶς ὡς ἔχουσιν οἱ νόμοι

children.definition: = foreg. II, π. ὅτι . . S.E. M. 7.188.
celebrate a festival beforehand, D.C. 37.54 ( Pass.). -έπω, administer beforehand, v.l. in J. BJ 2.14.3.
prepare beforehand, in Pass., δεῖ προδιειργάσθαι . . τὴν τοῦ ἀκροατοῦ φυχήν Arist. EN 1179b24, cf. Pr. 931a12, Parth. 23.2.

data.quote: δεῖ προδιειργάσθαι . . τὴν τοῦ ἀκροατοῦ φυχήν

children.definition: go scouting, l.c.: c.acc., search thoroughly, τὴν ὀροφήν D.S. 20.26.
spy, scout, X. Cyr. 5.4.4 (v.l.), Plu. Comp.Pel.Marc. 3.
go through before, of motions of the bowels, Hp. Acut. 67, cf. Coac. 64; Νέστορος προδιελήλυθεν ἀρετὴ τῶν Ἑλλήνων τὰς ἀκοάς X. Cyn. 1.7.

data.quote: Νέστορος προδιελήλυθεν ἀρετὴ τῶν Ἑλλήνων τὰς ἀκοάς

children.label: II
children.definition: go through or narrate before, ὃν τρόπον γέγραπται Aeschin. 2.67; τι D.S. 1.9; αἰτίαν J. AJ 4.2.1; περί τινος D.S. 3.11; ὡς . . J. AJ 12.3.3.

children.label: III
children.definition: precede, τῷ προδιεληλυθότι ἔτει the year before last, POxy. 1706.15 (iii A.D.); τῷ προδιελθόντι ἔτει PSI 4.295.7 (iii A.D.).
make clear beforehand, Hermog. Id. 1.4:— Pass., Plb. 6.11.1, S.E. P. 2.68 (v.l. προδιακρίνεσθαι), prob. in Herm. in Phdr. p.63A.
relate beforehand, premise, Hdt. 4.145, D. 59.1, Hermog. Inv. 2.4:— Pass., τὰ προδιηγημένα [ἔθνεα] Hp. Aër. 13.
preliminary exposition or narration, τῆς ἀπολογίας Aeschin. 1.117, cf. Arist. Rh. 1414b14, Hermog. Inv. 2.1, al.: pl., Aps. p.339H.
filter through before, cj. for προσ- in Arist. Pr. 933b37.
exude before, Gal. 17(1).988.
dilate previously, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.10.14:— Pass., Sor. 1.65.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., fall into discord beforehand, πρό τινος J. BJ 4.3.2.

children.label: III
children.definition: pf. part. Pass. -διεσταμένος fixed, determined beforehand, PRein. 7.11 (ii B.C.).
judge beforehand, Ph. 1.603:— Med., Poll. 8.24:— Pass., δίκας τὰς προδεδικασμίνας IG 5(2).343.15 (Orchom. Arc., iv B.C.).
preliminary proceedings in a prosecution for murder, Antipho 6.42 (pl.), cf. AB 186.
one who judges before or for another, Gloss.

children.label: II
children.definition: advocate, SIG 134b25,32( Milet., iv B.C.).

to be a patron, advocate, or guardian, τοῦ ἀλλοτρίου ἀπελευθέρου Lys. Fr. 100, cf. Plu. An seni 2.787b, Sollert. 973a; τῶν τούτου τέκνων Mitteis Chr. 88 i 15 (ii A.D.); τῶν ἐνύδρων Plu. Sollert. 2.975c.

children.label: II
children.definition: act as advocate, ὑπέρ . . GDI 1432b5 ( Hypata).
priority of trial, SIG 155a8 ( Delph., iv B.C.), etc.: pl., decrees granting this privilege, ib. 252.41 (ibid., iv B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: office of πρόδικος, advocacy, Plu. An seni 2.793e.
judged first, δίκα π. a cause which has priority of hearing, IG 9(1).334.32 ( Locr., v B.C.), cf. Michel 497.2 ( Aerae, iii B.C.), etc.
Act., judging in first instance, πόλις Schwyzer 328a iiB8 ( Delph., iv B.C.), cf. GDI 5040.63 ( Crete).
decided by arbitration, ἐθέλω δίκην δοῦναι πρόδικον Ar. Fr. 267; ἵνα ἀπολάβῃς τὴν τιμὴν τοῦ βάρδου πρόδικον BGU 276.12 ( ii/iii A.D., cf. ii p.355).

data.quote: ἵνα ἀπολάβῃς τὴν τιμὴν τοῦ βάρδου πρόδικον

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., defender, avenger, A. Ag. 450 (lyr.); representative in legal proceedings, advocate, γυναικὸς ἑαυτοῦ BGU 969.7 (ii A.D.); esp. of public advocates, IG 9(1).694.114 (Corc.): metaph., advocate, patron, τῆς ἐναργείας Plu. Comm.not. 2.1083c.
guardian, X. HG 4.2.9, Plu. Lyc. 3.
pass through before, Sor. 2.60 ( Pass.).
regulate, manage beforehand, D. 23.14 ( Pass.), Luc. Hist.Conscr. 52:— Med. in act. sense, Aeschin. 1.146, D.H. Rh. 9.7, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: digest before, σιτία προδιῳκημένα Antyll. ap. Orib. 5.29.10.
setting in due order beforehand, D.H. Rh. 10.13: pl., Vett.Val. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(1).165, Sch. Hermog. in Rh. 6.124 W.
regulating beforehand, τῶν ἐλαχίστων M.Ant. 1.16.
prepare before, ἑαυτόν Sch.D.T. p.170H.

agree in allowing beforehand, Pl. Ti. 78a, Arist. Top. 108b15; π. τινί c. inf., D.C. 38.14; π. ἵνα . . Id. 62.21:— Pass., προδιωμολογημένα points conceded on both sides beforehand, v.l. for προσ- in Pl. Sph. 241a; ἐκεῖνο προδιομολογείσθω Arist. EN 1103b34; τούτου -ομολογηθέντος Ph. 1.431.
one must grant beforehand, Arist. Top. 110a37.
correct, set right by anticipation, τὰ μέλλοντα Herm. in Phdr. p.109A.
setting right by anticipation, Hermog. Inv. 4.12, Alex. Fig. 3, Aristid.Quint. 2.10, Eust. 733.6.

limit or define beforehand, D.S. 12.2, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 146.17, al.; βραχέα π. περί τινος D.S. 1.4:— Med., ib. 5, Ph. 1.442, Hermog. Id. 1.1, Aps. p.247H. (also, make arrangements beforehand, Orib. 45.18.17):— Pass., Ph. 1.631.
previous definition or distinction, Gal. 6.830, Aps.p.243H.
strain beforehand, Dsc. 1.71.
get in advance in pursuit, Th. 6.70, f.l. in X. An. 3.3.10.

definition: προδίωξις, εως, ἡ, expl. of προΐωξις, Sch. Hes. Sc. 154.

children.definition: lie in wait for, Hsch.

seem good, be resolved beforehand, τὰ προδόξαντα IG 7.3563 ( Thisbe):—mostly in Pass., ὥσπερ προὐδέδοκτο αὐτοῖς had been before determined, Th. 7.18; τὰ προδεδογμένα Id. 3.40; ταῦτά μοι προὐδέδοκτο this was my former opinion, Pl. Phd. 88d.
place where one lies in wait, lurking-place, δεδεγμένος ἐν προδοκῇσιν Il. 4.107.
try, prove beforehand, Eust. 1890.28:— Pass., Ph. 2.305.
that which is given in advance, prepayment, advance of money, PCair.Zen. 269 (iii B.C.), Plb. 29.8.8, 15.25.16 (pl.), JHS 11.122 ( Ceramus), PTeb. 42.15 (ii B.C.), Hdn.Gr. 2.935, Hsch. s.v. ἀρραβών.
by way of payment in advance, μίσθωσις Sammelb. 5761.26 (i A.D.).
Hsch.
one who builds before, epith. of certain gods, Paus. 1.42.1.
build before, J. BJ 1.21.6 ( Pass.).

chamber entered immediately from the fore-court, ἐνὶ προδόμῳ πρόσθεν θαλάμοιο θυράων Il. 9.473; ἐν προδόμῳ δόμου 24.673, Od. 4.302: later, in temples, opp. ὀπισθόδομος, SIG 247 I 227 ( Delph., iv B.C.):— also πρόδομον, τό, Inscr.Délos 370.14 (iii B.C.), CIG 2754 ( Aphrodisias).
before the house, ἀοιδαί B. 6.14; πυρή AP 6.285 ( Nicarch.): c. gen., Ἑκάτη τῶν βασιλείων πρόδομος μελάθρων ( πρόδρομος codd.) A. Fr. 388 (anap.).
deem, judge beforehand, Pl. Tht. 178e, Arist. Metaph. 1011b6:— Pass., Id. Rh. 1356a10.
prejudgement, censured by Gal. 18(2).14.
judging hastily, Phryn. PS p.8B., Phot. p.140R., Suid. s.v. ἄνθρωπος π.
early supper, Schwyzer 725.1 ( Milet., vi B.C.).
abandonment in need, betrayal, E. Hel. 1633: mostly in Prose, treason, προδοσίην συντίθεσθαι Hdt. 6.88, 8.128; σκευάζεσθαι Id. 6.100; προδοσίας ἁλούς D. 24.127, cf. Pl. R. 443a (pl.).
payment beforehand, money advanced, Lys. Fr. 1.3 (pl.); δωρεαὶ καὶ προδόσεις D. 50.7,12.
προδόσει πίνειν to drink on credit, Hermipp. 83.

children.label: II
children.definition: betrayal, treason, Pl. Lg. 856e.
one must betray, abandon, Pl. Tht. 203e.

betrayer, traitor, Hdt. 8.30, 144, Timocr. 1.5, etc.; π. πατρός, πατρίδος, E. Or. 1057, Ph. 996, etc.; ὁ ἐν λέχει π. Id. Med. 206 (lyr.); π. τῶν ὅρκων traitor to his oaths, Lys. Fr. 71: metaph., τῆς ὑγιείης Democr. 234.
one who abandons in danger, A. Pr. 1068 (anap.); π. τινὸς καταστῆναι And. 2.26.
Adj., irreg. Comp. -ίστερον Phot.
traitorous, Luc. Cal. 13; τὸ π. χρυσίον a traitorʼs hire, Plu. QConv. 2.668a, Ath. 8.343e; treacherous, π. συνθῆκαι J. BJ 2.21.3; δῆμος Phalar. Ep. 77.2. Adv. -κῶς Luc. Tim. 36.
betrayer, E. Hel. 834, 1148 (lyr.), Ar. Th. 393, Com.Adesp. 595; γῆς, φίλων, E. Med. 1332, Hel. 931.
betrayed, abandoned, Trag. in lyr., S. El. 126, 208, 1074; π. ἐκ φίλων E. Hipp. 595.
servitudes, Cod.Just. 1.4.26.8, 10.30.4.11.
serving as a slave, of a shoe, A. Ag. 945.
enslave beforehand, Onos. 14.3; τὴν αὑτοῦ πατρίδα Ph. 2.322.
fall heavily before, pf. προδέδουπα Nic. Al. 313.
to be a mounted skirmisher, Arist. Ath. 49.1.
running forward: sally, sudden attack, X. An. 4.7.10: metaph., αἱ σαὶ π. τοῦ λόγου your lively sallies, Pl. Alc. 1.114a.
running forward with headlong speed, π. ἦλθον A. Th. 211 (lyr.); φυγάδα πρόδρομον S. Ant. 108 (lyr.), etc.; μόλε π. v.l. in E. Ph. 296 (lyr.).

running before, going in advance, π. στρατιή Hdt. 9.14; κήρυκας π. προπέμπειν Id. 1.60; π. ἥκω E. IA 424; freq. of horsemen in advance of an army, Hdt. 4.121, 122; π. τῶν ἄλλων ἥκειν Id. 7.203, cf. Th. 2.22; λεὼς π. ἱππότας A. Th. 80 (lyr.); mounted skirmishers, οἱ π. ‘guides’, a special corps in the Maced. army, Arr. An. 1.12.7, cf. D.S. 17.17; οἱ ἀμφὶ [τὸν ἵππαρχον] πρόδρομοι X. Eq.Mag. 1.25; at Athens, Arist. Ath. 49.1; also, of light ships, Alciphr. 1.11.
precursor, ἀστέρα . . ἀελίου π. Ion Lyr. 10; ἠπίαλος πυρετοῦ π. Ar. Fr. 332 (anap.); δείπνου π. ἄριστον Eub. 75.13; π. τοῦ δοκοῦντος καλλίστου εἶναι Pl. Chrm. 154a, cf. Plot. 6.7.7.
π. (sc. οἶνος), v. πρότροπος.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., πρόδρομοι, οἱ,
v. supr. I.2.
northerly winds, preceding the etesian winds, Arist. Mete. 361b24, Pr. 941b7, Thphr. Vent. 11.
early figs, Id. CP 5.1.5 sq., cf. Plin. HN 16.113.
= sq., τοῦ ἡλίου Gem. 9.1: abs., set earlier, prob. in Ptol. Tetr. 147 (cf. Sch.ad loc. p.137).
set before, τοῦ ἡλίου Arist. Mete. 343b20.
earlier setting, Gem. 16.16 (pl.), Vett.Val. 125.26, Man. 6.566.

children.label: II
children.definition: name of the sixth τόπος (below the W. horizon), Paul.Al. M. 1, Procl. Par.Ptol. 207, Antioch. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(3).117, Rhetor. ib. 8(4).154.
to be unfortunate before, Isoc. 4.141, 6.104, D.C. 48.42.
cause to be given up for very shame, π. τὴν ὁρμήν τινος J. BJ 2.14.7.

definition: προδωμάτιον, τό, Att. for προκοιτών, Phryn. 227, Hsch.

children.definition: present before:— Pass., τὰ προδεδωρημένα J. AJ 18.8.7.
wish to betray, προδωσείοντι ἔοικε Dam. Isid. 173.
betraying oneʼs companions, Scol. 14, D.C. 58.14.
boaster who breaks his word, Phot., Suid., Eust. 710.12: in codd. wrongly written προδοσ-.
great-grandson, CIG 4380b1.7 ( Cibyra), Ephes. 3.17, Just. Nov. 18.4 Intr.: also fem. προδρομ-εγγόνη, great-granddaughter, Cod. Just. 6.48.1.12.
to be inscribed beforehand, D.C. 39.17.
furnish security or guarantee, Milet. 3No.138.42 (iii B.C.):— Pass., App. Fr. 1.1.

definition: προεγγυεύω, only in Dor. form πρωγγυεύω, pf. inf. πεπρωγγυευκῆμεν, = foreg., Tab.Heracl. 1.155.

children.definition: furnishing security, Milet. 3 No.138.6 (iii B.C.).
surety, Tab.Heracl. 1.100, al., Schwyzer 394 ( Acarnania, iv B.C.), Milet. 3 No.138.39 (iii B.C.).
wake up before, ἑαυτούς Arist. EN 1150b23.

children.label: II
children.definition: προεγρήγορα, intr., continue awake, Id. Pr. 916b2 codd. (dub. l., προσ- cj. Bekker).
watch over, c. gen., Philostr. VA 8.7, Im. 2.17.
to be implanted before, αἱ -καθήμεναι αὐτοῖς ὁρμαί Plb. 3.15.9.
accuse before: Προεγκαλῶν, name of a play by Menander, Stob. 4.19.17.
to be laid or lie in before, τῆς -κειμένης τροφῆς Hdn. 1.17.10; to be interred previously, IGRom. 4.1284.31 ( Thyatira).
urge on before, Apollon. Lex. s.v. προβοῶντε.

definition: προέγκλιμα, ατος, τό, dub. sens. in Vett.Val. 354.11.

children.definition: use a clyster first, prob. (for προκλύζω) in Dsc. Eup. 1.231.
praise beforehand, Sch. Aristid. p.31D.
Phot., Eust. 1528.26.
engrave before, Ph. 2.229.
scarify first, Aret. CD 2.13.
attempt before the time, Plb. 2.68.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: test a matter beforehand, Arist. Top. 160b15:— Pass., τὰ περί τινος προεγχειρημένα S.E. M. 1.35.
to be taken in hand already, Heph.Astr. 3.4.
rub in or on before, Dsc. Eup. 2.19 ( Pass.), cj. for προσ- in Gal. 13.820.
make an infusion first, Hippiatr. 129; Subst. προεγ-ισμός, ὁ, ibid.
ἐδάφη BGU 15.18, al. (i A.D.).
front seat in a theatre, IG 5(2).113 ( Tegea), D.C. 59.7 (nisi leg. προεδρία).
= principatus, Gloss.

children.label: II
children.definition: chamber in front, IG 14.291 ( Segesta), Not.Scav. 1931.398 (ibid.).
to be πρόεδρος, act as president, Arist. Ath. 44.3; φυλὴ ἥτις προεδρεύσει Aeschin. 1.33; π. τῆς βουλῆς D. 22.9; τοῖς ἐναντία τοῖς νόμοις προεδρεύουσι Hyp. Phil. 5.

children.label: II
children.definition: sit in the front row in the theatre, Luc. JTr. 8, 11.

privilege of the front seats at public games, in theatres, in the public assemblies, bestowed as an honour on distinguished foreigners, ἀτελείη καὶ π. Hdt. 1.54, 9.73, cf. Ar. Th. 834, X. Vect. 3.4 (pl.), Decr.Byz. ap. D. 18.91; προεδρίην [ῑ] ἐν ἀγῶσιν ἄροιτο Xenoph. 2.7; on ambassadors, Aeschin. 3.76; on citizens who had deserved well of their country, and (sometimes) on their descendants, Ar. Eq. 575, 702; freq. in Inscrr., π. ἐν τῷ θεάτρῳ IG 2(2).1214.19, cf. SIG 1003.13 ( Priene, ii B.C.), etc.; π. τῶν ἀγώνων Pl. Lg. 881b; προεδρίαι ἐν ταῖς πανηγύρεσι ib. 946e: hence, generally, authority, εἰσὶν ἐν π. Arist. Pol. 1292a9; precedence, place, π. ἀπονέμεσθαί τινι Hdn. 1.8.4; ἐκστῆναι τῆς π. Plu. Vit.pud. 2.535b: in pl., Arist. Rh. 1361a35: metaph., τὸν αὐλὸν εἰς τιμὴν καὶ π. ἄγοντες Plu. Pel. 19; προεδρίας ἐτυγχάνομεν we received attention, respectful treatment, PSI 4.380.3 (iii B.C.), cf. Sammelb. 5942.12 (iii B.C.); later, care, τῶν πραγμάτων πολλῆς π. δεομένων BGU 747 i 15 (ii A.D.); π. τῆς κοιλίης Aret. CD 1.3.

data.quote: τὸν αὐλὸν εἰς τιμὴν καὶ π. ἄγοντες

children.definition: front seat, Δαρεῖον ἐν π. κατήμενον on a chair of state, Hdt. 4.88; ἐν τοῖσι ἀγῶσι π. ἐξαιρέτους Id. 6.57; ἐς τὴν π. πᾶς ἀνὴρ ὠστίζεται Ar. Ach. 42: esp., at Athens, seats of the πρυτάνεις in the Ecclesia, ἡ π. τῶν πρυτάνεων Din. 2.13.

data.quote: ἐς τὴν π. πᾶς ἀνὴρ ὠστίζεται

children.definition: of a πρόεδρος, Arist. Ath. 59.2.
one who sits in the first place, president, Th. 8.67; ἐν δίκῃ Pl. Lg. 949a, cf. PPetr. 3p.44 (iii B.C.): metaph., ὁ τῆς μαντείας π. ἀετός Arist. HA 601b2.

children.label: II
children.definition: presiding officers of the βουλή or ἐκκλησία, Lex ap. D. 24.21, Aeschin. 2.65, Arist. Ath. 44.2; οἱ λαχόντες π. IG 2(2).779.11, 1227.23, al.; τοὺς π. οἳ ἂν λάχωσι προεδρεύειν SIG 158.5 (iv B.C.), etc.; similar officers at Mytilene, Th. 3.25; ὁ τῶν Αἰτωλῶν π. App. Mac. 9.1; μέλλοντος τοῦ π. τὸν δῆμον ἐπερωτᾶν Plu. Arist. 3, cf. ἐπιψηφίζω I.2; π. Ἑρμοῦ πόλεως city councillors of Hermupolis, BGU 1027 i 10 (iv A.D.).

data.quote: τοὺς π. οἳ ἂν λάχωσι προεδρεύειν
μέλλοντος τοῦ π. τὸν δῆμον ἐπερωτᾶν

children.definition: hinder or stop by standing before, c.acc. et inf., πάντας προέεργε ὁδεύειν Il. 11.569.
train beforehand, ἡμᾶς ἐπὶ τὰ μείζονα Plu. Vit.pud. 2.531a:— Pass., to be so trained, Arist. Pol. 1337a20; εἰς ὃ δεῖ ἐλθεῖν προειθισμένοι X. Cyr. 6.2.29.

children.label: II
children.definition: accustom beforehand, c. dat., Gal. 14.256:— Pass., Id. 2.223.
become accustomed, τινι Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.36. 4.

children.label: III
children.definition: εἰ μὴ -είθισται ταῦτα if these things have not been settled beforehand by custom, Simp. in Epict. p.110D.
one must train beforehand, ἑαυτὸν πρᾷον εἶναι Plu. Cat.Ma. 5.

definition: προεῖδον, aor. with no pres. in use, προοράω being used instead, part. προϊδών, inf. προϊδεῖν:—

children.definition: look forward, ὀξὺ μάλα προϊδών Od. 5.393; see beforehand, catch sight of, μή πώς με προϊδὼν . . ἀλέηται 4.396; ὅτε προΐδωσιν ἰόντα κίρκον Il. 17.756, cf. 18.527, Hdt. 3.14:— Med., προΐδωνται Od. 13.155; χαλεπὸς προϊδέσθαι καπρός Hes. Sc. 386 (v.l. προσιδ-).
foresee, portend, κακότητος ἀνάγκας Orac. ap. Hdt. 7.140; ἐσσόμενον Pi. N. 1.27: abs., Pl. Lg. 691b:— Med., X. An. 6.1.8, D. 9.68, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: take thought for, ἡμέων οἰκοφθορημένων Hdt. 8.144; καθʼ ἡσυχίαν τι αὐτῶν (sc. τῶν ἀποβαινόντων) Th. 1.83:—mostly in Med., προϊδόμενος ( προειδομένους codd.) αὐτῶν Id. 4.64; τοῦ μέλλοντος προϊδέσθαι D.C. 45.19; ὅπως μὴ . . D. 54.17; προϊδέσθαι ὑπέρ τινος Id. 23.134; οὐδὲν τοῦ χωρίου προείδετο did not worry about . . , D.C. 56.13.
form an idea of beforehand, Hld. 9.25 ( Pass.).
conjecture beforehand, τὰ μέλλοντα Arist. Rh. 1358b20.

go forward, advance, κατὰ βραχὺ προϊών Th. 1.64; ὀλίγα βήματα προϊόντες X. Cyr. 7.5.6; π. τῆς ὁδοῦ X.Eph. 4.3; of the Nile Delta, προϊούσης τῆς χώρης as it advanced (by deposit from the water), Hdt. 2.15.

προϊόντος τοῦ χρόνου as time went on, Id. 3.96; προϊούσης τῆς πόσιος, π. τοῦ συμποσίου, Id. 6.129, X. Cyr. 8.4.13: προϊούσης τῆς νυκτός Id. An. 2.2.19; π. τῆς ἡλικίας, τῆς συνουσίας, Pl. Phdr. 279a, Tht. 150d; προϊόντος τοῦ λόγου, τοῦ ᾄσματος, Id. Phdr. 238d, Prt. 339c; τοῦ προϊόντος ἔτους the current year, BGU 1126.6 (i B.C.): ἡ ἐργασία κατὰ τοὺς τρεῖς χρόνους π. Hermog. Prog. 9.

data.quote: ἡ ἐργασία κατὰ τοὺς τρεῖς χρόνους π.

children.definition: proceed, continue, προϊὼν καὶ ἀναγιγνώσκων going on reading, Pl. Phd. 98b; πρόϊθί γε ἔτι εἰς τοὔμπροσθεν Id. Grg. 497a, cf. Lg. 842a; ὁ λόγος προΐτω Plot. 2.4.4.
go first, go in advance, X. Cyr. 1.5.14, 2.2.6: c. gen., go before or in advance of, τῆς ἄλλης στρατιῆς Hdt. 1.80: metaph., π. τοῦ καιροῦ X. Cyr. 6.3.29.
go forth, θύρασι Ar. Th. 69; π. ἔξω τῆς φάλαγγος X. Lac. 12.3 codd.; π. τοῦ οἴκου Hdn. 1.17.4; appear in public, ἐν ἐρεᾷ ἐσθῆτι PGnom. 182 (ii A.D.).

children.label: b
children.definition: spring from, γῆς τε καὶ ὕδατος Aphth. Prog. 6.
π. εἴς τι pass on to, begin another thing, X. Eq. 10.13; π. εἰς ἄπειρον Arist. EN 1094a20, Ph. 209a26: hence, become, ἐξ οἰκέτου δεσπότης π. Luc. Nigr. 20.
π. ἐπὶ τὸ λῷον succeed, X. Vect. 6.3.

to be before, τά τʼ ἐσσόμενα πρό τʼ ἐόντα things which were before, Il. 1.70; οἱ προόντες γεωργοί the former cultivators, PTeb. 379.12 (ii A.D.); αἱ προοῦσαι τάξεις the previous positions, Ael. Tact. 29.10; but, οἱ προόντες those who were there before (and still are there), Ath. 9.391d; ἀνῳκοδόμησα ἐπὶ προοῦσι θεμελίοις ἀρχαίοις Sammelb. 5232.19 (i A.D.); τῇ προούσῃ αὐτοῦ γυναικί his present wife, PSI 1.36a5, 27 (i A.D.), cf. PRyl. 154.4 (i A.D.); τὰ προεσόμενα Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.586f (s.v.l.); also τοῖς προοῦσι δίδωμι the aforesaid, POxy. 580 (ii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: προεσόμενα, = profutura, Gloss.

definition: προεῖπον (also -εῖπα Plb. 3.114.8), aor. with no pres. in use, προλέγω and προαγορεύω being used, part. προειπών, inf. προειπεῖν:—

children.definition: foretell, Pl. Euthphr. 3c, al., Gal. 14.601; premise, τοῦτο προειπόντα ἐπειπεῖν τὰ ἔμπροσθεν Arist. Rh. 1394b31.

children.label: II
children.definition: proclaim or declare publicly, ἀλλήλοισι πόλεμον π. Hdt. 7.9.βʹ; ξεινίην τοῖσι Ἀκανθίοισι π. Id. 7.116; ἀγῶνας ἑκάστοις X. Cyr. 1.6.18; νικητήρια ταῖς τάξεσι ib. 2.1.24; θάνατον αὐτῷ π. μὴ πράξαντι ταῦτα Pl. Lg. 698c; π. τινὶ φόνου make proclamation of murder against him, D. 59.9, cf. Lex ap.eund. 43.57; π. τοῖς θεοῖς ὅτι . . Pl. Cra. 401a; ὀνυμάξει αὐτὸν προειπὼν τρῖς ἁμέρας giving notice of three days (within which he must answer the call), Berl.Sitzb. 1927.167 ( Cyrene); ἐν ἡμέραις πέντε ἀφʼ ἧς ἂν ἀλλήλοις προείπωσιν BGU 1050.27 (i A.D.).

data.quote: θάνατον αὐτῷ π. μὴ πράξαντι ταῦτα
ἐν ἡμέραις πέντε ἀφʼ ἧς ἂν ἀλλήλοις προείπωσιν

children.label: III
children.definition: inf., order or command before, πρό οἱ εἴπομεν . . , μήτʼ αὐτὸν κτείνειν Od. 1.37, cf. Hdt. 1.21, 155, 7.12, S. OT 351; οἱ νόμοι προεῖπον αὐτῷ μὴ δημηγορεῖν Aeschin. 1.3; π. τοῖς καδεσταῖς ἀλλύεθθαι Leg.Gort. 2.28: c. acc. et inf., π. σῖτον ἐσάγειν τὸν βουλόμενον Th. 4.26; π. αὐτῷ δήσειν threatened him that . . , And. 4.17.

data.quote: πρό οἱ εἴπομεν . . , μήτʼ αὐτὸν κτείνειν
οἱ νόμοι προεῖπον αὐτῷ μὴ δημηγορεῖν

children.definition: enjoin, c. acc., π. Λυδοῖσι τὰ ὁ Κροῖσος ὑπετίθετο Hdt. 1.156.

data.quote: π. Λυδοῖσι τὰ ὁ Κροῖσος ὑπετίθετο

children.definition: pacify beforehand, J. BJ 3.1.2, 4.8.1.

bring in, introduce before (sc. εἰς τοὺς φράτερας), D. 39.32 ( Pass.); ἐπὶ τὴν χώραν τἀδελφοῦ IG 2(2).1326.31 ( Pass.); τὴν κακίαν τῆς ἀρετῆς Plu. Comm.not. 2.1066d; τὰ προεισηγμένα measures previously introduced, v.l. in J. AJ 19.2.2; in writing, introduce or describe first, τὸν τοῦ πρεσβυτέρου [βίον] Plu. Dio 2; ἡ προεισηγμένη σφραγίς aforementioned, PHamb. 12.20 ( iii A.D., prob.), cf. Stud.Pal. 17p.25 (iii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἑαυτοῦ π. go on the stage before oneself, Arist. Pol. 1336b29.
throw in a remark before, περί τινος Socr. Ep. 36.

children.label: II
children.definition: start, make a beginning, ἀπὸ τοῦ φόβου Longin. 22.2.
supervene, come on before, τῆς ὥρας Aët. 5.23.
involve in previous ties: οἱ προεισδεδεμένοι persons bound by previous alliances, Plb. 9.31.1.
go in before, εἰς τὸ ἄστυ Hld. 9.1.
come or go in before, D. 28.14, D.S. 16.94; τὸ προεισεληλυθὸς πνεῦμα Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.10.14.
contribute in advance, ἐκ τῶν ἰδίων ἄτοκα τὰ χρήματα SIG 569.37 ( Cos, iii B.C.).

data.quote: ἐκ τῶν ἰδίων ἄτοκα τὰ χρήματα

children.definition: introduce previously, Pass., οἷς μὴ ἀρέσκοιτο τὰ προεισηγημένα J. AJ 19.2.2 (v.l. προεισηγμένα).
introduction, prelude, Hld. 8.17.
burst in before, Hsch.
send in before, X. Cyr. 5.2.6, J. AJ 14.11.6, Luc. Alex. 11, etc.
go in before, Sch. E. Or. 58.

definition: προεισπράσσω, in Pass., of a debtor,

children.definition: to have money prematurely exacted from him, PCair.Zen. 367.18 (iii B.C.).
advance money to pay the εἰσφορά for others, Id. 42.25, 50.8; generally, advance money to the State, SIG 344.115 ( Teos, iv B.C.); ἀργύριον ἄτοκον π. IG ΙΙ(4).1055.11 ( Delos, iii B.C.), etc.
introduce a law before, in Pass., Poll. 5.166, Lib. Decl. 39.3:— Med., introduce before (in writing), ὄνομα Sch. Ar. Ach. 321.
confer previously, χάριν τῇ πόλει Lib. Decl. 22.27, cf. Or. 12.37.
money advanced to pay the εἰσφορά for others, D. 37.37, 50.9.
advance of money to the State, Inscr.Prien. 108.51,56 ( ii B.C., pl.); χρημάτων SIG 1003.30 ( Priene, ii B.C.).
preliminary expenses, Lib. Decl. 33.18.
one who contributes to a προεισφορά, Inscr.Prien. 108.78 (ii B.C.).
throw out, eject before, Arist. HA 605a7; squeeze out first, ἰκμάδα Dsc. 5.87.

children.label: II
children.definition: calculate first, τὸν τῆς τύχης κλῆρον Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.167.
previous going out, Eust. 1394.14.
launch prematurely, εἰς πόλεμον Plb. 20.3.2 (leg. προεμ-).
consume, exhaust before, Plb. 9.43.2 ( Pass.).
intercept before, ὄρη π. ἀνέμους Str. 15.3.10; τοὺς κινδύνους J. BJ 7.6.4.
teach thoroughly before, J. AJ 17.6.1 (prob. l. for προσ-), Them. Or. 32.358b, Iamb. VP 12.58 codd. (leg. προσ-).
publish beforehand, Plb. 16.20.7:— Pass., ἐν τοῖς προεκδοθεῖσι ὑπομνηματισμοῖς D.H. Th. 1, cf. PTeb. 27.59 (ii B.C.), A.D. Synt. 3.1, Gal. 18(2).1024.

children.label: II
children.definition: προεκδοῦσα κοιλία excreting before, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.100.
previous edition, Sch. A.R. 1.285, etc.
running out in advance, of troops, Poll. 1.164.
boil off before, τὰ ὄστρεα Ruf. ap. Orib. 4.2.19.
warm thoroughly before, Orib. Syn. 1.27 ( Pass.).
introduction, preface, τῆς πραγματείας Plb. 3.1.7, 8.11.2; prefatory account, Scymn. 13, D.H. Comp. 23, Quint. Inst. 9.2.106.
one must premise, Str. 17.1.1.
introductory, prefatory, σχῆμα Eust. 20.42, etc.
run out before, sally from the ranks, rush on, Th. 7.30, J. BJ 2.16.2, Arr. An. 1.1.12; ἐν τοῖς δρόμοις Jul. Or. 2.69d.
outrun, τοῦ λογισμοῦ Plu. Virt.mor. 2.446d; ὁ λόγος προεκθεῖ Ael. NA 13.11.
leap out before, Eus.Mynd. 34: c. gen., ἡ Ἄρτεμις π. τοῦ Ἀπόλλωνος Sch. E. Hec. 458.
cleanse, purify before, J. AJ 18.5.2; γῆν Sor. 1.40, cf. Lysis ap. Iamb. VP 17.76, Sch. Luc. Cat. 24.
inflame first (sed leg. προσ- (?)), Gal. 11.392.
procitat, Gloss.
lie before, project beyond, στέρνα τὸ μέτριον π. Philostr. Jun. Im. 15: but usu.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass. of προεκτίθημι, to be fixed in advance, ἡ προεκκειμένη ἡμέρα Cic. Att. 6.5.2; to be set forth previously, τὰ -κείμενα Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1012.33, etc.; τὰ -κείμενα προστάγματα PTeb. 5.224 (ii B.C.); οἱ -κείμενοι λόγοι A.D. Synt. 10.24; αἱ -κείμεναι [ἀρεταί] the above-mentioned . . , Longin. 11.1; to be cited above, Ath. 3.105c.
τὰ -κείμενα πτωτικά case-forms presupposed by or underlying adverbs, A.D. Adv. 170.26.
drain off beforehand, J. AJ 3.1.2, Sch. Il. 9.223; evacuate first, Gal. 15.721: metaph., exhaust a subject, Sch. Hermog. in Rh. 4.490 W.
rinse out first, Gal. 11.132, Androm. ap.eund. 12.631, Apollon.ib. 647.
carry out beforehand, Hdt. 2.63: metaph., ὑπὸ τῆς τύχης -κομισθεὶς ἀναίμακτος Plu. Tim. 37.
Med., remove first, τῇ χειρί Hippiatr. 75.
remove faeces first, Paul.Aeg. 3.43.
excise first, τοὺς σπονδύλους Gal. 2.682:— Pass., ib. 702.

children.label: II
children.definition: destroy first, Lib. Or. 39.15.
anticipate a crisis, Hp. Hum. 13 (dub.l.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., -κριθέντων τῶν ὑγρῶν carried off first, Dsc. 1.47; to be cleared out first, Sor. 2.63 ( προκρ- cod.).
previous secretion, interpol. in Artem. 4.84.
push or drive out before, Vett.Val. 337.12, D.C. 43.4.
shine out before, Them. Or. 16.201d.
collect moneys before or in advance, [ τὰ] προεξειλεγμένα D. 18.234, 50.9; χρήματα π. ἀπὸ τῆς Ῥόδου App. BC 5.2.
fail to assist, τινα Hp. Ep. 10:— Pass., to be evacuated previously, J. AJ 17.10.9.
calculate before, Ph. 2.279, Mithr. Ep.Brut.Praef., Hierocl. in CA 12p.447M.

relax before, τὸν στόμαχον Ath. 2.45e; weaken beforehand, in Pass., Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.123, Gal. 13.566; reduce the force of a blow, Id. UP 3.8; π. τὸ ἐνστατικόν weaken theresistance beforehand, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 531.18.
release first, τὴν δεξιάν Sor. 1.111 ( προσ- cod.).

children.label: II
children.definition: weary before the time, τῷ κόπῳ τὰ σώματα Plb. 15.16.3:— pf. part. Pass. προεκλελυμένος Anon. ap. Suid. s.v. ἐκπαθεῖς.
weaken the force of a projectile, J. BJ 3.7.22:—so in Pass., of sounds, Ph. 2.140.
learn by heart before, Theon Prog. 3, Sch.D.T. p.18H.
wipe out first, Gal. 12.409, 13.665.
suck out first, Sor. 1.87 ( Pass., προσ- cod.).
clean beforehand with νίτρον, Dsc. 4.136, 5.1, Cleopatra ap. Gal. 12.404:— Pass., Antyll. ap. Orib. 7.21.3, etc.
one must clean beforehand, Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.13.30.
send out before, Ph. 2.110, J. AJ 13.7.3, Plu. Cam. 41, Alc. 34; ἐλπίδας περὶ σεαυτοῦ Lib. Or. 55.33.
leap out before, Thphr. CP 1.19.1, 4.6.7; τῆς τάξεως D.S. 12.64: metaph., [ πάθος] π. τοῦ λόγου Them. Or. 19.232d.
drink off before, Plu. Amat. 2.768d, Ath. 5.193a.
fall or come out before, precede, τὸ κῦμα π. τοῦ πνεύματος Arist. Pr. 932b37: metaph., get abroad before, φήμη Plu. Galb. 5; π. εἰς γένεσιν Id. Def.orac. 2.427e.

children.label: II
children.definition: go beyond limits, Str. 1.2.3; π. τὸ ἀδύνατον Longin. 15.8 ( προσ- cod.), cf.38.1.
sail out before, Plu. Arist. 23, Nic. 20.
scare or astound before, J. AJ 18.9.7, Onos. 29.2, Plu. Lys. 25, Luc. Ind. 9, etc.:— Pass., Id. Alex. 16.
alienate before, Just. Nov. 159 Praef., 162.1.
work out, finish before, Semon. 22.
going beyond limits, Str. 7.3.4 (pl.).
flow out first, Orib. 45.3.8.
break out suddenly or prematurely, χειμῶνες π. Hp. Epid. 1.4; also of diseases, Id. Hum. 13, Gal. 9.916.
stretch forth, Apollon. Lex. s.v. προΐηλε.
bring quite to an end before, Ael. VH 13.1.
cut out first, Apollon. Lex. s.v. πρότμησις.
melt before: metaph. in Pass., προεξετήκοντο λύπαις Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.107a.
put out or publish before, λόγον ζητήματος Plu. Stoic.rep. 2.1035b; ἔστιν ἃ εἰς τὸ δημόσιον D.C. 53.21.
build out, as a salient or projection, Ph. Bel. 84.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: set forth or expound before or by way of preface, τὸ πρᾶγμα τοῖς ἀκούουσι π. Arist. Rh.Al. 1436a40; διʼ ἃ -τεθήκαμεν Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1055.23: more freq. in Med., Plb. 1.13.1, Str. 1.2.31, J. AJ 12.2.5: so in pf. Pass., καθότι -τεθείμεθα SIG 685.56 ( Magn. Mae., ii B.C.); καθʼ ἣν -τεθείμεθα τήρησιν A.D. Synt. 70.1, cf. Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.21.15.
Med., secrete and prepare beforehand, τοῖς ἐμβρύοις ἡ φύσις π. τὴν τροφήν Arist. GA 746a3.

data.quote: τοῖς ἐμβρύοις ἡ φύσις π. τὴν τροφήν

children.definition: lay before, [ τὰ ᾠά] prob. in Arist. HA 549a17: abs., πρὸ ἀρκτούρου ib. b11.
pluck out before, τρίχα Gal. 12.742:— Pass., Aët. 11.11.
pay before, Them. Or. 16.199c ( Pass.), Chor. in Lib. 4.85R.
run out before, Ph. 1.166, al., Plu. Cor. 9, Pel. 23.
shoot out before the season, Thphr. CP 2.1.6.
to be born before, τινος Lib. Or. 5.4.
wear out beforehand, App. BC 4.108.
mould or model before, τὸν νοητὸν κόσμον Ph. 1.4.
put out before, τὴν χεῖρα LXX Ge. 38.28.
utter, pronounce before, Demetr. Eloc. 51.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be carried away headlong, Aristipp. ap. Stob. 3.17.17 (s. v.l.); of runners, Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.128.
escape before, Plu. Mul.virt. 2.250e, D.C. Fr. 78.3; ἐπὶ πλοίου Id. 38.50.
set on fire before, Olymp. in Mete. 31.23 ( Pass.).
scare before, Plu. Mar. 19, Luc. Salt. 18, D.C. 42.14:— Pass., Plu. Mar. 26.
previous panic, Th. 5.11, D.C. Fr. 109.18.
go forth, be announced previously, D.C. 69.1.

children.label: b
children.definition: anticipate a statement, οὐ -φοιτῶν ἀλλʼ ἐν τῷ παρόντι ταμιευόμενος Ph. 2.294.

data.quote: οὐ -φοιτῶν ἀλλʼ ἐν τῷ παρόντι ταμιευόμενος

children.definition: go forth beyond, c. gen., Stob. 2.7.14.
first remove obstruction, Gal. 8.375, Orib. Eup. 4.100:— Pass., Gal. 15.72.
pronounce one thing before another, τί τινος S.E. M. 1.125 ( Pass.).
pour out before, Luc. Pseudol. 4:— Pass., Sor. 1.57.
go out before, D.C. 41.41, v.l. for προσεκχωρέω in 43.39; τῆς πόλεως Id. 50.2.
riding forward: cavalry charge, X. Eq.Mag. 8.3 (pl.).
ride on or forward, X. An. 6.3.14(17): c. gen., ride before one, Id. Mem. 3.3.1:—also in Pass., of Time, ὡς πρόσω τῆς νυκτὸς προελήλατο as the night was now far advanced, Hdt. 9.44.
refute before: pf. part. Pass. -εληλεγμένος Oenom. ap. Eus. PE 6.7.
to be set free before, D.C. 48.34.
issuing forth, Sm. Ex. 21.7, al., Olymp. in Mete. 147.23; ἐκ τοῦ παλατίου Tz. H. 6.491; progress, procession, π. θριαμβική Eust. 1292.16.
Luc. Prom.Es 6.
παραμύθιον τῆς π. μου a reward for my trouble, PFlor. 332.20 (ii A.D.).
prolixe, Gloss.
be ulcerated before, Dsc. Eup. 1.150.
Gloss.

draw, drag forth, Ael. VH 4.15: metaph., lead on, entice, τὸ μειράκιον εἰς πότον J. AJ 15.3.3:— Med., προελκυσάμενον τὴν ἐσθῆτα having drawn it over his head, Sch. S. Aj. 245: metaph., lead on, τοὺς κυνηγέτας π. οἱ κύνες ib. 7.
hope for before, Posidipp. 27.8, Them. Or. 5.65a; προηλπικότες ἐν Χριστῷ Ep.Eph. 1.12: generally, anticipate, expect, Gal. 16.822, Dexipp.Hist.32(h) J., Simp. in Epict. p.50D.
enter a boat first or before, Plu. Pomp. 78; enter a ford first, Philostr. VA 2.15.

put in or insert before, ἄμμον εἰς βαλανοδόκην Aen.Tact. 18.3; ἐς τὴν ὀπὴν τοὺς πόδας Paus. 9.39.11: metaph., π. τινὶ κατελπισμόν Plb. 3.82.8:— Pass., Thphr. Od. 18; of words, Arist. Rh. 1407a28; to be applied previously, of bandages, Gal. 18(1).801.
deposit beforehand, ἀρραβῶνα PCair.Zen. 637.6 (iii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: προεμβαλλόντων ἐς τὴν γῆν τῶν κερέων the horns butting into the ground in front, of cattle with projecting horns, Hdt. 4.183.

children.label: b
children.definition: project, be prominent, Philostr. Gym. 10, cj. in 34.
make the charge ( ἐμβολή) first, Th. 4.25: with acc. expressed, π. [τῇ νηΐ] πληγήν Plb. 16.3.2: hence, generally, attack before, τινι D.S. 15.81.
make an inroad before, εἰς τὴν Γαλιλαίαν, ἐς τὴν Ἀρμενίαν, J. BJ 2.20.6, D.C. 36.45, cf. 37.1.
belonging to a προεμβάτης, γέρας π. a reward given one who first boarded the enemyʼs ship, Hld. 5.31.
one who first boards the enemyʼs ship, Hld. 5.31.
put in before, π. τινὰς εἰς ἀπέχθειαν make them hated before, Plb. 2.45.4; cf. προεκβιβάζω.
shipʼs beak, IG 2(2).1613.58: also προεμ-βολίς, ίδος, ἡ, Poll. 1.85:
soak first, Asclep.Jun. ap. Gal. 13.163.

definition: προέμεν, Ep. aor. 2 inf. of προΐημι (q. v.).

children.definition: vomit beforehand, aor. part. -εμέσας Orib. Fr. 81: pf. part. fem. -εμημεκυῖα Dsc. 5.67, cf. Eup. 2.20.
practise before, τοῖς τοῦ βίου πράγμασι Ph. 1.551.
to be filled up before, Luc. Cal. 8.
burn first, ἐρύματα D.C. 54.5.
fall on or into before, ἡ βολὴ π. τῷ ὕδατι Hld. 9.5; attack first, Ael. Tact. 37.6; take the first step, εἰς γνῶσιν D.L. 4.39.
protrude into, c. dat., Gal. UP 7.7; προεμπίπτει τὰ χείλη, of a bear trying to bite a net, Plu. Aet. phys. 2.918f.
blow into before, τῷ καλάμῳ τὸ μέλος Him. Or. 12.3.
previous buyer, AB 296.
buy first, AB 296.
insist on, emphasize before, App. BC 4.125.
appear before, Longin. 17. 2.
previous manifestation, Dam. Pr. 118, 122 (pl.); τῶν εἰδῶν Simp. in Ph. 422.6; foreshadowing, τινος Id. in Cat. 246.18.
to be filled full before, κακίας Plu. Comm.not. 2.1067f.
